message+desc: Ever wonder what happens at Seoul's Hangang River afterdark?  I went for a walk last night at around 11 pm last night and came across this scene.  Seoulites feel safe in their city, and they take time out to excercise even late. Walking, jogging, skateboarding, rollerblading, biking.  You name it!
comments:
amazing what people can do afterdark, there :) $$Oh I love walking down by the River at night it is soo peaceful and great skyline views$$i know! i went to Î≥¥ÎùºÎß§ one time at like 10, expecting it to be empty or nearly empty. Much to my surprise, it was packed! there was even a group of ÏïÑÏ£ºÎßàs doing an exercise class!! „Öã„Öã„Öã$$Isn't it usually packed until about midnight? I love going out late in Korea!$$sleepless night in seoul!!! $$DongDaeMun Market area doesn't even really get moving until about 11PM and then is rather active until 2 or 3AM$$Yeah, the wholesale area is full of people from around the country looking for inventory for their clothing stores into the wee hours.$$The South Korea is the most safest place to live and work, especially for children and for young people! I love South Korea~~$$When I first came to Korea, I went to the convenience store at around 11 at night.  I ended up exploring the back streets and suddenty thought...."Marie! You're in a new country! What are you doing out here in the dark by yourself?!"  And then I heard a sound right behind me!  I was so scared, I turned around and saw.... A pregnant woman pushing a baby stroller. Figured if even a woman with a baby and a half with her was confidently strolling around at this hour, I would be okay.  

And then I never worried again (but I'm still careful of course mom!).

Marie

message+desc:
A UNESCO World Heritage site, Champaner-Pavagadh, in #Gujarat, is known for its splendid monuments, temples, mosques, pavilions, lakes, mansions and fortifications. 

Situated 50 km north of Vadodara, Champaner-Pavagadh has 114 magnificent monuments, 38 of which are protected by the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI). It is also one of the few medieval heritage sites in India that showcases a unique combination of Islamic & Hindu architecture.

What is it like? 
Relaxing, snorkeling, diving and eating ‚Äî lots of eating. Just some of the things you can do on this island. Almost every resort here will offer diving trips and courses. But don‚Äôt worry. Even if you decide to stay on land or on the water's surface, the scenery is just as enchanting.

message+desc:
Darjeeling
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
High up near the Himalayas with Mt. Kanchenjunga as a backdrop, Darjeeling in the state of West Bengal, is worth a visit, where, ancient forests, quaint houses and friendly people make the trip to this most famous hill station of India worth it. The mystique of Darjeeling is glamorous thanks to its landscape. 
The toy train enables travellers to explore the wonderful hill station at a calm pace, soaking in the environs and culture of every part of destination that is Darjeeling.

message+desc: The Philippines has the world‚Äôs longest discontinuous coastline (34,600 km). That's pretty long! That means we have lots of beaches! Roll call: name the beaches you love going to in the country at the comment section!
comments: Canada has the longest. Indonesia's is also longer than the Philippines'. What's with the misinformation?$$We got our information from a study conducted by Joan Regina Castro of the Path Foundation Philippines and other websites that confirm this. In fact, the Institute of Public Information Canada has an article that begins with "The Philippines, with the longest discontinuous coastline in the world..." So, we didn't want to go against the experts! Canada and Indonesia might have a longer uninterrupted or unbroken coastline, but in the whole world, we have the longest, discontinuous coastline. At least that's recognized. :D$$Sta Cruz Island where the sand is pink..$$No doubt, we have the longest discontinuous coastline. Just add up all the beachlines of the 700+ big and small islands that constitute the archipelago.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Boracay, Aklan

What is it like? 
Before the last day of the year, Filipinos will be busy preparing for Media Noche ‚Äì the New Year's eve feast. There will be firecrackers, noisemakers and 12 kinds of round fruits on dinner tables, because these are believed to bring wealth in the coming year. 

Fun Fact: 
Don't be surprised if you see Filipinos jumping as high as they can at midnight on New Year's eve. There's a superstition that doing this will make you taller. While most people know it's just an old wives' tale, they still do the New Year jump for the fun of it. 

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Tin Sanchez
comments: I wana be there. But I already spent 70 days in the Philippines this year 2014 truly blessed$$Still do the jumping at Media Noche and put lots of coins in my pocket!! :)$$Happy new year to allüéÜüéáüéâüéä$$I wish i could be there,Maybe in 2015.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
El Nido, Palawan

What is it like? 
Starfish, also known as sea stars, are one of the most popular creatures on the sea bed. Although Palawan has a place called Starfish Island in Honda Bay, this particular orange starfish was found biding its time on Snake Island.

Fun Fact: 
The mouth of a starfish is found in its center. Though it's hard to imagine, these creatures have intestines and a stomach. But they also have an ability to digest food outside their bodies, and so can feed on prey much larger than their mouths.

Photo by/Author: 
Tin Sanchez
comments: At the northern part of palawan.. from puerto princesa city to roxas 135km. Next roxas to taytay 75km. Taytay to el nido35km.. enjoy ur journey....

Inspired by renowned Indonesian writer Andrea Hirata, author of The Rainbow Troops, the festival will showcase a wide variety of traditional and contemporary dance and musical performances, and a festive cultural parade. This event will coincide with the arrival of yachts in the Sail Karimata Rally and in the Sail Indonesia and Sail2Indonesia boat rallies from Australia. #WonderfulIndonesiaTurning the spotlight to the beautiful island of Belitung in the province of Bangka-Belitung off the south eastern coast of Sumatra, the Land of the Rainbow Troops Festival will be held from 21st to 23rd October 2016 at Tanjung Pandan, capital city of Belitung Regency.

message+desc:
Sasangir - Preserve of the majestic Asiatic Lion and several other unique species

Located in the state of Gujarat, Gir Forest National Park and Wildlife Sanctuary, also known as Sasangir, is an entrancing preserve for the Asiatic Lions. The proclamation of the Gir forest as protected in 1990s by the rulers of the princely state of Junagarh saved them from extinction, and currently their population stands at 411. 

The seven rivers of the forest create a landscape filled with evergreen vegetation along the riversides, dry deciduous and tropical thorn forests. Though the undisputed highlight of the Sasangir is obviously the Asiatic Lions, the park is home to 38 species of mammals, 37 species of reptiles and more than 300 species of birds. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/sasangir
comments: Been there sadly saw no lion but my friend saw a panther!

message+desc:
23 Words Mispronounced By Singaporeans Their Whole Lives

Is flour pronounced "flahr" or "flo-wer"? It doesn't matter. You will deny it when you know the real answer.

Here are 23 words Singaporeans have been mispronouncing all their lives. 

99.9% of Singaporeans mispronounce #9.

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/words-singaporeans-mispronounceIs flour pronounced flahr or flower? Here are 23 words Singaporeans have been mispronouncing all their lives. 99.9% of Singaporeans mispronounce #9.
comments:
There's also croissant and almond. Don't mind if Singaporeans mispronounce as long they don't try to correct me when I'm pronouncing it correctly. I have come across native British speakers mispronouncing certain words like how Americans mispronounce and now passed into general acceptance. English is much more practical than it used to.$$Vegetable is vejtable :) lol, it took a while to get familiar with all the proper pronunciation. After living oversea for years, enough embarrassment while communicating with foreigners,  I have put in huge effort to drop most of the mis pronunciation. No more Singlish , no more manglish :)$$Another word would be library is often pronounced as "lai-bree" instead of "lai-bray-ree$$"Christian" and "Christianity".$$A word is only mispronounced when the people u are trying to communicate with cannot understand it... Try asking for "flower"  instead of "flah" in our supermarket... 

So American pronunciation and Queens English...  which is right? 

This article makes me uneasy becos its undermining our Singaporean and singlish culture which is unique to us...

We don mispronounce... we just do it differently...$$I'm not sure if those on local media still pronounce Ears as Years, as they used to when I was a consumer.$$You have to add 'liaise'!$$Keep hearing the word "prestigious" being mispronounced on tv and radio here ALL the time.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Siquijor, Visayas

What is it like? 
The island is famous for its virgin beaches and secret swimming spots. But the thing about Siquijor that probably resonates the most is its reputation for magic and sorcery. During Good Friday, the island is supposedly the go-to place of witchdoctors from all over the country who are looking to recharge their amulets.

Fun Fact: 
Local healers can concoct potions made from oils and herbs for visitors to take home. A scented lana (coconut oil-based ointment) made by a healer is believed to be relieve one of stomach aches and body pains.

Photo by/Author: 
Livre Napiere Lacierda/Jao Bautista
comments: Travelled extensively all of the Philippines , one day I return not just to travel or to live , I cannot think of a better place to be Kaye's to rest ...$$One of the best beaches here maher we will visit  buddy ........I will just wait you here$$I have been twice in Siquijor and I love the place. It is really nice to know somebody in every place who are kind hearted like the family of Caracol who make my stay really feel at home and welcome. Gid Bless to the Family of Claudio and Lucy Caracol especially Daughter Clair. Their relatives and family are really nice.$$Ive been to this this island. Not just once.  Earl Kevin Jumawan Malolot my personal tour guide.   :)$$My husband is from Lazi ,Siquijor ! Love the place ,been there twice but cannot tolerate the boat ride due to motion sickness !!

message+desc: Is that a space ship? No, it's Selinog Island, located off the coast of Dapitan, Zamboanga del Norte. Photo by Ruel Tabada

message+desc:
Panoramic Autumn view with National treasure

Aichi prefecture has a number of beautiful Autumn foliage spots. You can enjoy even with the Japanese castle in Inuyama City which is located in northwestern Aichi. It is a national treasure with the oldest castle tower in existence in Japan, which still remains the atmosphere of an old castle town built in the 17th century. November is the best month to enjoy both natural and cultural value.

Aichi Pref.
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/aichi/index.html
http://www.aichi-kanko.jp.e.io.hp.transer.com/
comments: I've ever visited this castle!beautiful place!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron Island is a sure path to natural beauty, replete with staggering limestone cliffs, fine coral-fed beaches, and thirteen picturesque lagoons to boot.

Fun Fact:
The island's geothermal energy causes a thermocline, warming the lake waters up the deeper you go.

Photo by: Adrien Uichico
Copy by: Corey Cruz

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
Coron is a first-class municipality in Palawan known for its beaches and shipwreck dive spots.

Fun Fact:
Tamilok -- shipworm dipped still-wriggling in spice vinegar -- is a local delicacy. Extreme foodie Andrew Zimmern had some on his television show, Bizarre Foods!

Photo by Adrien Uichico

message+desc:
We set off for Tokyo with a mission to clear as many non-touristy activities as possible, and that has led us to a rundown warehouse building, roller coasters with a death wish, and Mario karts that can be ridden across Shibuya crossing. 

This trip was made possible with M1 Data Passport, an ingenious service which allowed us to use internet in Tokyo at local data bundle pricing. Find out more by watching the full video here: https://youtu.be/89RC2EP2k3o

message+desc:
Who else is excited for the cherry blossoms?
Jinhae Gunhangje Festival is the largest and longest-running cherry blossom celebration in Korea, and it will take place from April 1-10, 2013 ‚Üí http://bit.ly/161sTfp

Highlights:
March 31 - Opening ceremony
April 1 to 10 - Yeojwacheon Stream festival of lights
April 5 - Jinhaeru multimedia fireworks 
April 6 to 8 - Military Music Festival 
April 6 - Admiral Yi Sun-shin commemoration ceremony
April 6 - Cherry blossoms street culture festival
April 7 - Cherry blossoms silver festival 
April 7 - Grand ritual ceremony

For the full schedule, you can download the pdf here >>> http://gunhang.changwon.go.kr/2013/gunhang_pdf.pdf (Korean only)

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan, Visayas

What is it?
Club Paradise Resort is surrounded by a house reef which is easily accessible to divers and has a diverse marine system. Near this reef is the feeding ground of sea turtles and dugongs (sea cows) ‚Äì the gentle giants of the sea. There are tours that take you along the coast of Busuanga for some dugong-watching.

How to get there? 
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

Fun Fact: 
Some believe that stories of mermaids came about when lonely sailors spotted dugongs swimming in the ocean, and mistook their shape as that of half-woman, half-fish creatures.

Photo by/Headline by:
George Tapan/Tin Sanchez
comments:
Seriously, I did not know Palawan is now in Visayas.
Please look into this. Thank you. ^^

BBOUNCE is Singapore's first trampoline fitness studio featuring Hybrid Rebounding, which combines different movements and exercises while on the trampoline. 
It's a fun and novel way to exercise where you can literally bounce your fats away!

DBS/POSB cardholders will be entitled to a one time fitness trial at $16 (U.P $35) as well as a free 1-month fitness pass when you purchase a 12-month fitness package.

Bbounce Studio - Address: 176 Orchard Road #06-09, The Centrepoint, Singapore 238843

Follow TheSmartLocal.com and never miss our posts again!

message+desc:
Have you ever being scared to take MC? Feeling paiseh about passing work on to your colleague? Or is the boss giving you the dirty look for requesting for some time off to recuperate? 

Singaporeans work very hard, because we all want to make our lives a little better. Some of us work so hard that we neglect our own health and insist on going to work even when we are sick. That's why in this episode of Word On The Street, we find out if Singaporeans work too hard.

***GIVEAWAY ALERT!***

Well, here's your chance to win staycations at Hotel Jen @ Orchardgateway or Lloyd's Inn, or a couple's spa retreat at Adeva Paragon so you can take a well-deserved break in style. Visit http://on.fb.me/1SOVMb1 for all the details! GOOD LUCK!

Originally posted on our YouTube channel here
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lXfj_aU2mVI

Business Enquires: admin@thesmartlocal.com
comments:
Come to my workplace and ask. Hahaha. Where your performance is determined by the amount of MCs you take. No matter how shitty your work is, but if you have zero MCs you are a good employee. I took only 2 mcs for last year because of menstrual cramps. Now Im marked for 2016. Hows that. LOL$$Healthcare group as well. You fall sick, you're deem as incapable and incompetent in taking care of patients because "you obviously can't even take care of yourself."$$For NS as well. To get an SAR A, you need to have 0 MCs.$$Thats a church singer right?$$Ever heard of tax efficiency?
Well, singaporeans have perfected MC-efficiency by strategically using all MC days by the end of year. Smart.$$Singapore is a tryhard country ma...$$https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LD2DPdSUzqU Reminds me of this though. Haha.

On April 4th, the new Shinjuku Highway Bus Terminal, called ‚ÄúBus-ta Shinjuku‚Äù, opened. This bus terminal is located just near the New South Exit of JR Shinjuku Station. 
The terminal is easily accessible, and makes it easy to find bus stops for buses going in every direction.

Related Information: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/arrange/transportation/auto/bus.html
comments:
When I came in Japan I mostly used trains but also buses, metro, once a taxi, feet, boat,... To go from Hiroshima to Izumo I preferred to use the bus in place of Shinkansen. It permitted me to see other facets of Japan :-)$$I just used it today. To find it, it was very difficult. You have to know that it faces the South entrance at Shinjuku. 
And why are there so few information in English in the main room where you can get information? Words are written in kanji. How can you understand that some counters are for travels to book in advance and some for today's travels?
I was surprised by that as Tokyo will welcome the olympic games in 2020.$$We purchased a 7 day JR pass back in 2013 to go from Narita to Kyoto, Nagoya and back to Tokyo... Then paid for trains and bus service on demand basis for the rest of our stay. It was a good bargain, so we felt.$$Trains, subway, trams (Nagasaki) ... having a Rail Pass and a Suica card makes things a lot easier in most cases$$Used it once, when I have trip to Sendai. message+desc: Howrah Railway Station is the oldest railway station and the largest railway complex in India. With 23 platforms, it is one of the busiest railway stations in the country in terms of passenger volume per day. The #Howrah railway station also has the distinction of being the railway station with the highest train-handling capacity.
comments: Howrah railway station (HWH) in West Bengal, India is the largest railway station in all of South Asia by area! It daily handles the largest number of trains than any railway station in the Indian subcontinent! Having 23 platforms in all, the highest in South Asia, it possesses one of the most complex and massive route relay interlocking systems. Mail, Express, Passenger, MEMU, DEMU and Kolkata suburban railway commuter trains (EMU trains) throng the railway station very frequently. Passenger density, train density and track density is one if the highest in the country. The railway station is operated both by Eastern Railway (Howrah Division) and South Eastern Railway (Kharagpur Division) of Indian Railways, the 3rd largest passenger railway network in the world! The OHE of the railway station is fully AC electrified.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Cocoa Beach, Puerto Galera

What is it?
Cocoa Beach Island Resort is a sprawling 10-hectare paradise with crystal clear waters lined by coconut trees and wooden bungalows. The resort has four restaurants, a tennis court, two swimming spools and a spa.

Fun Fact:
A "service family" who live close to your cottage will take care of you during your stay at the  resort. They offer baby-sitting services for three hours, and even a full-time nanny to take care of the kids.

Photo by / Headline by:
Teddy Pelaez / Tin Sanchez
comments: I think it's Coco Beach. :)$$never heard of COCOA Beach... pls. edit. it's COCO$$I was there last year.next year going to borocay!$$Yeah! It's Coco Beach

message+desc:
Eskaya Beach Resort & Spa is a beautiful resort-spa in Panglao Island, which is at the southernmost tip of the famous Bohol, Philippines. It is located halfway through Panglao along its coast facing the Bohol Sea. It is a sprawling property which covers 16 hectares. The topography of the resort is diverse. It has a gradually descending cliff, flat land, a ravine, caves, and has the commanding view of the sea.

The resort is a stylish boutique, which accounts for its exceptionality. Architecture of the building is decidedly Filipino with a splash of modern amenities. The thatched villas or "balai" in the dialect, are single-detached. These are built with sturdy construction materials, but the use of indigenous materials like bamboo, cogon, and wood is emphasized. Most of the villas have individual private swimming pools. The focal point of the resort is the infinity swimming pool, which definitely blends with the sea. The spacious restaurant has a cool feeling, yet with a warm ambience and plenty of the sea view and swimming pool view. Dining can also be at the beach al fresco, at the poolside and in the garden.

Stay in your very own villa for 3 days and 2 nights when you bag #TagTheFun's grand prize! Enter the photo contest now!

www.agoda.com/morefunph
http://bit.ly/1WB4GbW

message+desc: "I would love to visit Indonesia. My ancestors are Dutch Indonesian. I want to go to the island of Java where my great-grandparents are from. I'd like to see where my roots are from" Kim Vandenberg A bronze medalist of swimming at the 2008 Olympics

And the older people there can speak dutch. Goodluck$$Im a dutch indonesian too:)$$Karen, you and your fellow Dutch citizens of mixed parents as well as other Dutch people are most welcome to visit Indonesia, particularly Java where your great-grandparent come from. including Surakarta (Solo) and Yogyakarta, the cradle of sophisticated Javanese art & culture, the monumental Budhist/Hindu temples of Borobudur and Prambanan.  Get Indonesia Travel to guide you. Nogmaals welkom!$$When i was younger, my parents (and more of my family's in the Netherlands) and i spend the summer-holydays in Indonesia. We went to all different places: Jakarta, Bogor, Mid-Java, Surabaya etc, and i saw many of the beautiful cultures as the borobudur etc. My dream is to buy my dreamhouse in Bali one day!! Haha!!! Bali is amazing! :)

message+desc:
A "kotatsu" is a table that has a heater installed underneath and is covered with a futon blanket to warm your legs as you sit.
Once you sit down however, you might not be able to get back up! 
It‚Äôs like a vortex of comfort and warmth! Kotatsu is another of Japan's hidden gems waiting to be enjoyed.

Learn more: http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1611_kotatsu.html

When I visited Japan in March 2014 it was still cold and in the ryokans in Japanese alps I was really happy to have kotatsu :-)$$Kotatsu are the best!  One of my favourite things about Japan, along with ofuro/onsen, the food, and of course, the best of all, its people$$I love kotatsu. I used to spend many hours at the kotatsu in winter. Spotlight: Benedicto Cabrera, better known as Bencab, is a painter and a National Artist for visual arts. He was born in Malabon but now lives in Baguio where he put up the Bencab museum featuring his own works, works of other masters, and exhibitions of new contemporary artists. 

Photo of the BenCab Museum taken from ourawesomeplanet.com
comments: Been here on the way to Asin Spring. Nice paintings and lots of native wood carvings.$$Must visit in Baguio. Very interesting collection of art.

message+desc:
We received a tip from one of our readers that the Sin Ming Avenue chickens were actually an endangered species called the Red Jungle Fowls.Some are now crying fowl - the dearly departed chickens from Sin Ming Avenue might be an endangered species.

The Red Junglefowl was even featured in a BBC documentary by David Attenborough.

https://mustsharenews.com/endangered-chickens-singapore/
comments:
I can personally confirm that these endangered Red Jungle Fowls were part of the BBC Documentary as I was roped in to help the film crew to gather them. 

Photo was taken in 2014 before the land was being redeveloped into a condominium.$$Complainants, you stink. Repent repent or live in Sin forever. AVA officer who made d decision to murder d fowls, you deserve all d curses heaped on you. RIP dear roosters$$Only in SG would you kill an endangered species..........  must be time to go to a cofeeshop or hawker stall to chops some seats before shouting at one another in the typical SG way!$$Chicken make some noise straight away cull them. Being punished because of their natural animal behaviour. Then why some fools like to make so much noise, no one not culling them.$$Sad to no longer seeing them roam freely at the green patches. 

Left and right all taken up by new condo developments. The chickens had not much of a choice to go into nearby housing dwellings behind thomson view. 

Previously no complaints for a few years. Its only when their land bank has shrunked then they ventured inner into human space. 

AVA could move them to venus drive and relocate them there. But having done that will encroach into the monkey spaces. Do left also salah, right also salah. Haha$$I hope that those officials involved in it will get some form of punishment..And may this incident haunt those who had filed the complaints..Nothing beats guilt that stays in wt person till death. The poor chickens were minding their own business..$$There are many ways to free the roosters, like sending to farms or reservoirs or park... I don't understand why the need of slaughtering.. not about endangered, it's about the unnecessary act of killing. Really stupid.$$üò†üò≠üò≠üò≠big mistake for the killing.. at least it should be release to nearby reservoirs ie...macritchie, upp or lower pierce or ..ie..sister, ubin, kusu, corney islands etc....so many to choose from n away from residents.$$It's sad to see AVA not realizing the fact these are endangered species! And to those who complains, you've made history in causing their extinct üò°$$What is wrong with these people can't they just leave all the animals alone in Singapore why every thing want to cull or kill has our society come to this stage shocking$$| Well well, AVA is not known as "Always Very Alamak" for nothing. üòä$$When a mistake is made, just come clean and say so, but don‚Äôt cover up.$$Those who knew the chicken will be culled and still complaining... life's nothing to them??$$May the complaints be reincarnted to be red jungle fowls in their next lives to be culled also$$So they ended up as roasted chickens on whose reunion dinner?$$Start culling fools... They will spread fool's flu.. everyone at risk to fools$$An honest mistake, forever. Maybe there will be a national holiday to commemorate them?$$SG cannot even tolerate chicken calls. Should a war breaks out and shells rain here, who will they "kou bei" to ?$$Well, Karma will cull all these complainant's next generation. Just wait...$$Ignorance breeds stupidity. Maybe treat some of the complainants to KFC?$$Hill street area has as well. Let's hope nothing happens to that bunch.$$They should reveal who made the complaints like all those stupid straits times forum letters.$$Travesty!
How can kill cock in year of chicken?$$Remember. Chicken is love. Chicken actually died for you.

message+desc:
23 Words Mispronounced By Singaporeans Their Whole Lives

Is flour pronounced flahr or flower? You'll be surprised.

Here are 23 words Singaporeans have been mispronouncing all their lives. 

99.9% of Singaporeans mispronounce #9.

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/words-singaporeans-mispronounceIs flour pronounced flahr or flower? Here are 23 words Singaporeans have been mispronouncing all their lives. 99.9% of Singaporeans mispronounce #9.

message+desc:
You might have thought that Tokyo is in lack of nature.
This is not true. For example, you can enjoy the scenery of gingko trees in November.
To enjoy gingko tree viewing, there are many popular places in the city center.

Meiji Jingu Gaien in Shinjuku is famous for its roadsides trees. The ‚ÄúGolden Road,‚Äù indeed, looks like a beautiful painting. And, the National Diet Building is surrounded by the trees. As wind blows, the gingko leaves turn into a golden carpet on road and you can imagine how amazing the scene is.

In the suburb of Tokyo, Showa Kinen Park which is located in Tachikawa City, you can enjoy gingko tree viewing with a cup of green tea at a Japanese garden.

You may find some locations in Japanese dramas!

More information:
Fall on foot 
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/seasonal/seasons_2004autumn-winter/foot.html
National Diet Building
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/histarch/national-diet-building.html
Shinjuku Gyo-en Garden
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/gardens/shinjukugyoen.html

message+desc:
June 30th is the last day of the first half of the year, the day of ‚ÄúNagoshi-no-harai‚Äù, or purification ceremony. 
On that day, some shrines in Japan put ‚ÄúChinowa‚Äù, cogon grass rings, at shrine gates that visitors walk through, praying for the preservation of their good health continuing into the latter half of the year.
In addition, some cities also have a habit of eating Japanese confectioneries called ‚ÄúMinazuki‚Äù. Would you like to experience this unique ceremony and taste these treats?

Related Information; https://www2.city.kyoto.lg.jp/koho/eng/preview/15.html 
http://www.kitanotenmangu.or.jp/top_en.php

message+desc:
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know how it‚Äôs possible, but I have been both hardened AND softened by my experience here,‚Äù writes American traveler Nathan Allen about his travels in the PH. Read his straightforward, honest assessment of the country and let us know your thoughts! 

http://www.idreamedofthis.com/2013/11/27/what-i-really-think-of-the-philippines/Heartfelt (and hilarious) observations after living in the Philippines for a year.
comments:
I'm not confused. I love it here, retired in Cebu for a year & half now, did take me a while to just slow down after 35 years in San Francisco Bay Area, have been all over Cebu Bohol Negros Oriental and the best Palawan. Yes poverty is pervasive but the Filopino people are the friendliest most humble on the planet.$$Wonderful article and very honest about these remarkable people. I have been blessed to have married a beautiful Phillipino women ha and family. She is an incredible wife. I plan on retirement in the fils. Slow my life down and love and support my aswa with all my heart.$$I've been to Manila and Cebu. I loved them both and especially fell in love with the joy of the people who live here. üòç$$This is just garbage written by a woolly-brained American liberal wracked with misplaced white guilt. The Philippines is fine. Happiness isn't about material wealth at all--though wealth is great! 

And the wonderful thing is, the economy in the Philippines is about to boom. Many many people are going to experience so many good things very soon there. They have finally solved the only real problem they ever had: Corrupt thieves posing as politicians.$$I've also been there for a month living with the people living in the privince and witnessed some city boys and girls begging for money on every corner in the cites. Yes people in the province were different. I heard they emphasize happiness over financial richness several times. Meanwhile I got some chances to talk privately with the young girls (not the boys) then I noticed some different inner sides and desires. They mostly said that they wanted to live in a bigger house and hoped that they would be able to go abroad to live a richer life with modern environment. Briefly speaking they said they want to live in a more modern style than now. Of course they said they are happy with the current life with their family members and relatives but deep inside I found that they yearn for some different lives as in the TV dramas or in some films. Happiness is indeed something relative. If the girls hadn't seen any more developed coutries and lives first or secondhand they would be perfectly content with their recent lives. But the opposite is the case for those girls living in the 21th century. I come to an conclusion which is half subjective and half objective that people in PH have two inner sides in one of which they are really happy despite of lack of money and in another they hope for a better more modern life now.$$This is just purely an opinion from a foreigner who is just merely comparing Phil and his home country- just his personal unsolicited observation. In anyway doesn't represent the Filipino culture as a whole. Indeed Westerners have high standard of living but working at least 16 hrs a day with two or three different jobs just to be able to pay their taxes, bills and credit cards for a lifetime!!! I still choose the Filipino way.$$Was in the Philippines two times now. Loved it and plan to come back. Have friends there and i see how hard their life is! As in any country in the world there is light and darkness....till now i had no bad experiences and hope the next trip will be as wonderful as before. Im thankful to read about other peoples trips and how they see things. Looking forword to go back and see more places!$$Thank you for being true in your observation and expressing your feelings about our country and I'm glad you saw the good and bad side of it with an open mind and an open heart....I applaud you for your post and you are more than welcome to come and visit our beautiful country again and again...God Speed$$I've been to Philippines two times now. I love it! I'm married to Filipina and one day would love to retire there. Very good article!$$The Philippines is my most favourite destination. The beauty of Bohol and friendly people makes me excited to come back soon. I have also encouraged my friends not to look past it with so much to explore, but no balut for me !!!$$Nice, honest and candid of Mr Allen's stay in the Phil. 

Thank you for both the great and challenging stories you shares. Visit Phil again.

Thank you guys for loving my country!$$I pretty much agree with you, on everything. Even though,  I've been going to the Philippines for the last 10 years, and my wife is from Luzon, I really enjoy the warmth of the Filipinos!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Intramuros, Manila

How to Get There:
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.

Or take a boat from any major Philippine port.

The tradition of the kalesa (horse-drawn carriage), was brought to the Philippines by Spaniards in the 18th century. They were originally reserved for nobles and the power elite, but are now commonly used on tours of the historic Intramuros district.

Fun Fact:
Very close to Intramuros and a must-see for all tourists is the Binondo Chinatown -- the oldest Chinatown in the world, established in 1594.

Photo by/ Headline by:
Abby Yao / Magnus Ahmad
comments: Perfect for a wedding

message+desc:

message+desc:
Kausani - Peace among thickly forested lanes and Himalayan views
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Located 53 km. to the north of Almora, Kausani, the brithplace of Hindi poet Sumitra Nandan Pant, is a picturesque hill station famous for its scenic splendour and its spectacular view of the Himalayas. Situated at 6075 feet above sea level, atop a narrow ridge, Kausani is thickly forested and separated from the soaring Nanda Devi ranges by low mountains. In 1929, Mahatma Gandhi stayed here at the Anasakti Ashram.

- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/kausani
comments: It is a historical place in lNDIA ? Its a nice place....

A list of 14 common Singaporean quirks that never fail to perplex foreign visitors. #12 will decide if you will ever be able to understand us.

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/ang-moh-singaporeansThis list includes 14 common Singaporean quirks that never fail to perplex foreign visitors. #12 will decide if you will ever be able to understand us.

I cringe every time i hear ppl say "lai-yers" or "lay-yers".$$You're exaggerating. Unless you know the culture and customs of countries all over the world, you can't claim that all these are uniquely Singaporean. For example, kiasu-ness is not, and people in Japan and Taiwan also avoid the priority seats in their trains. For them, it is the courteous thing to do because they do not fall into the categories for these priority seats. Who's to say our people are not doing so for the same reason? Also, how do you know people in other countries do not complain? As far as I know, they take their complaints even further, by picketing, striking, etc. Stop putting Singaporeans down with these derogatory comments.$$Yeah I understand of all of these and I do all of them$$Iam so sick of " 6"...which is so irritating$$Complain everytime everywhere üòÇ Katelyn So$$Hahahaha about 10 are completely true Cindy Wiggle Macadongdong. Î≥µÏ°∞Î¶¨ [bok-jo-ri] - bamboo strainers
It is believed that hanging these at the beginning of a new year brings good fortune for the rest of the year.

Originally the bokjori was used to dip up washed rice; to remove small stones and straw. Today, the concept is the same, to capture good fortune, while sifting away bad fortune.

#UNESCOdesignated: Changdeokgung Palace Ï∞ΩÎçïÍ∂Å
Listed as a #UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site in 1997, #Changdeokgung is the most well-preserved of the five remaining royal #places. It is comprised of a public palace area, a #royal family residence, and a rear #garden, also now commonly known as the 'secret garden'. Don't forget to check out the gigantic tree that is over 300 years old, the #beautiful small reflecting pond and the pavilion when you visit! :D 

Find out more ‚òû bit.ly/UNESCOchangdeokgung

message+desc:
Where is it?
Palawan, Puerto Princesa

What is it?
The series of protruding limestone formations unique to Palawan make the province home to lakes as well. These lakes are formed when water is trapped in the spaces in between the limestone cliffs. 

Fun Fact:
A Palawan getaway wouldn‚Äôt be complete without limestone cliff diving. The otherworldly rock formations make a picturesque backdrop for jumpshot-off-the-cliff photos.

Photo by / Headline by:
George Tapan / Jao Bautista

I'm a little jealous of all the people who are going to the beach, but it's nice to sit down on the subway!„Öã„Öã„ÖãAny plans for your summer vacation?

If you wish for fantastic and unforgettable travel experience throughout your lifetime, then you‚Äôd better come and visit Raja Ampat. From the highest point in the sky down to the ocean floor, Raja Ampat has the fascinating beauty for everyone. If there is a tour destination you must visit at least once in a lifetime, Raja Ampat is one of them. 
As part of Coral Triangle, Raja Ampat comprising over 1.500 island, cays, and shoals surrounding the four main islands; Misool, Batanta, Salawati, and Waigeo. It makes this area well-known as the richest marine biodiversity. But, exploring Raja Ampat is not always about diving. You can visit one of the 18 most beautiful villages in West Papua: Arborek. http://ow.ly/RUCf7

#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: Harborek village with beautiful jetty to diving$$This one is the most beautiful

message+desc:
Segara Anak is a crater lake contained within Mount Rinjani on the Island of Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia. It‚Äôs located on the west side of Mt. Rinjan in the Village of Lawang Sembalun. 

The name Segara Anak means Child of the Sea given to the blue color of the lake reminiscent of the sea. The lake spans across an area of 11 square kilometers and over 2,000 meters above the sea level. It reaches depth up to 230 meters and considered as a holy place, holds a deep-spirituality for the local people. 

Every fifth full moon, religious ceremonies are held on this lake. During the rituals, small gold fish are released into the lake to honour the goddess Enjini, the queen and ruler of Mount Rinjani.
http://ow.ly/RtT2q
#WonderfulIndonesia #PesonaIndonesia
comments: Lucy Truman & Kelli Ryan, this is where I had my little "ahem" drama I told you about today. Stunningly beautiful which helped distract me üòã$$Bryan Meneses are you sure not going to indonesia again? :p

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Pasay, Metro Manila

What is it like? 
On the first day of September, the Filipino Christmas season unofficially begins. Christmas trees and star-shaped lanterns start to fill the streets. Schools start to put together plays about the birth of Jesus Christ. Christmas remixes of the year's most popular songs start to play on the radio. The whole country is transformed for a solid four months. It's the longest Christmas celebration in the world. And it also has a good claim to being the happiest. 

How to get there: 
Fly into Manila through one of more than 30 international airlines. You can also fly in from any major Philippine city.

Or take a bus from any major city in Luzon.

Or take a boat from any major Philippine port.

Fun Fact: 
Adults or children form groups and visit homes at night to sing carols. When given change, young carolers typically sing a thank-you song in Filipino that goes, "Thank you, thank you, you're so kind, thank you!" When given change money, the song changes to, "Thank you, thank you, you're so stingy, thank you!"

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Tin Sanchez
comments: Philippines , here we come.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Davao, Mindanao

What is it?
Davao is the third most populated city in the Philippines. It's also the largest in terms of land area. There are many reasons to visit Davao. One is to see Mt. Apo, which has the highest peak in the country. Another reason is to go diving in one of its many world-class dive sites. The most popular ones are Angel's Cove, Marissa Dive Site, Ligid Pinnacle Point, Ligid Caves, Dapia Dive Site, Babu Santa Minwall Dive Site, Coral Garden Dive Site, Dela Paz Corner Dive Site, Mushroom Rock Dive Site and Tagbaobo.

Fun Fact:
SCUBA is not just a word ‚Äì it's an acronym that stands for "self-contained underwater breathing apparatus."

Photo by / Headline by:
Alexey Stoyda / Tin Sanchez
comments: Happy christmas Phillipine and Phillipians.$$I LIKE PHILLIPINES I LOVE Phillipine$$Merry Christmas and God bless!$$Its more fun in the phillipines.

message+desc:
We usually refrain from posting political stuff, but this is a message that should be shared a million times over.An Open Letter to Donald Trump:

Mr. Trump,

I try my hardest not to be political.  I‚Äôve refused to interview several of your fellow candidates.  I didn‚Äôt want to risk any personal goodwill by appearing to take sides in a contentious election.  I thought: ‚ÄòMaybe the timing is not right.‚Äô  But I realize now that there is no correct time to oppose violence and prejudice.  The time is always now.  Because along with millions of Americans, I‚Äôve come to realize that opposing you is no longer a political decision.  It is a moral one. 

I‚Äôve watched you retweet racist images.  I‚Äôve watched you retweet racist lies.  I‚Äôve watched you take 48 hours to disavow white supremacy.  I‚Äôve watched you joyfully encourage violence, and promise to ‚Äòpay the legal fees‚Äô of those who commit violence on your behalf.  I‚Äôve watched you advocate the use of torture and the murder of terrorists‚Äô families.   I‚Äôve watched you gleefully tell stories of executing Muslims with bullets dipped in pig blood.   I‚Äôve watched you compare refugees to ‚Äòsnakes,‚Äô and claim that ‚ÄòIslam hates us.‚Äô  

I am a journalist, Mr. Trump.  And over the last two years I have conducted extensive interviews with hundreds of Muslims, chosen at random, on the streets of Iran, Iraq, and Pakistan.  I‚Äôve also interviewed hundreds of Syrian and Iraqi refugees across seven different countries.  And I can confirm‚Äî the hateful one is you.  

Those of us who have been paying attention will not allow you to rebrand yourself.  You are not a ‚Äòunifier.‚Äô  You are not ‚Äòpresidential.‚Äô  You are not a ‚Äòvictim‚Äô of the very anger that you‚Äôve joyfully enflamed for months.  You are a man who has encouraged prejudice and violence in the pursuit of personal power.  And though your words will no doubt change over the next few months, you will always remain who you are.  

Sincerely,
Brandon Stanton
comments: Voters have eyes to see ears to hear, they know the truth about who is good and who is not :)

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
The wrecks of a World War II Japanese supply fleet are the main attraction for most divers in Coron. The ships have long since become part of the surrounding marine habitat. They're even home to scores of corals and fish.

Fun Fact:
The ten wreck sites have something for everyone's tastes. They were even listed in Forbes Traveler Magazine's "Top 10 Best Dive Sites in the World."

Photo by / Headline by:
Adrien Uichico / Magnus Ahmad

message+desc:
Over 400years history, Snow dome Festival in Akita!

In wintertime, many of Japan's snow-related customs can still be found in the Yokote area. The area is famous for the "Kamakura"(snow dome) festival where children gather in constructed snow houses. The water god is honored in Kamakura and this festival has history of over 400 years. In the evening, children offer sweet nonalcoholic rice wine and sweets. More than 100 snow domes are built in the city during the event.

Akita Pref.

http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/akita/index.html

http://www.akitafan.com/en/index.html

message+desc:
[New] 6 Pay-As-You-Wish Places In Singapore.

Instead of falling trap to ripoffs, you can choose the amount you'd like to pay at these 6 places in Singapore that go by a pay-as-you-wish system.

Note: It‚Äôs a liberating feeling getting to pick your own prices, and everyone likes cheap stuff. But if you‚Äôre not hard-up for cash, try to pay a reasonable amount, especially if you‚Äôve had a good experience. 

Remember that many of these business owners have implemented pay-as-you-wish systems out of goodwill, and still have costs to cover to keep their ventures running. Some are even donating all proceeds to a good cause, so give what you can!

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/pay-as-you-wish-placesInstead of falling trap to ripoffs, you can choose the amount you'd like to pay at these 6 places in Singapore that go by a pay-as-you-wish system.

message+desc: Located at the centre of Auroville, the #Matrimandir (Temple of The Mother), is an edifice of great spiritual importance for practitioners of Integral yoga. Designed by Roger Anger, the project took around 37 years to be completed. A place for individual silent concentration, Matrimandir does not belong to any specific religion or sect. Matrimandir is an epitome of innovation and architectural excellence; it is designed as a massive sphere encapsulated by twelve petals. The golden discs in the dome reflect sunlight, giving the structure its radiance. The meditation hall or the inner chamber contains the largest optically-perfect glass globe in the world.
comments: Stunning  , Really a beautiful peaceful place.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Boracay, Aklan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Caticlan. 

Or fly from Manila to Kalibo, then take a bus to Caticlan. 

Or take a boat from Manila to Caticlan.

What is it like?
When packing your bags for Boracay Island, shoes should be the least of your concerns. You'll be walking barefoot on the powder-fine sand most of the time. And sitting on it. And getting massages on it. You'll form quite an attachment to Boracay sand. Just please don't take any of it home! Leave the beach for others to enjoy.

Fun Fact:
Come dusk, young boys and girls take to the beach to begin sculpting impressive pieces of sand art. For a small fee, they can even personalize the sand art for you!

Photo by / Caption by:
Ryder Aquino / Nikki Golez
comments: nice  place  i be there  next month!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!$$I wish i could there..$$Boracay is nice, but far too commercialized for my liking. My experience there was nice. It is an enjoyable place, especially for the younger crowd! It clearly is a tropical paradise filled with natural beauty that rivals anything in the world.$$White Beach in Boracay is now included as one of the best beaches in the world, according to TripAdvisor, http://edition.cnn.com/2015/02/18/travel/tripadvisor-travelers-choice-best-beaches/index.html

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Anilao, Batangas

What is it? 
The town of Anilao may not have white sand beaches, but its underwater environment is its biggest attraction. Dubbed as the birthplace of scuba diving in the Philippines, its deep waters teem with marine life and an abundance of corals and reefs. For non-divers ‚Äì the shallow and low-current waters are great for snorkeling. Dive and Trek's house reef is a marine sanctuary frequented by several snorkelers.

How to get there: 
Take a bus to Batangas from Cubao or Pasay.

Fun Fact: 
Diving conditions in Anilao are ideal for divers of all experience levels. The water temperature is consistently warm, and the surface is typically calm and smooth throughout the year.

Photo by/Headline by: 
Tanya Burnett/Donna Dimayuga
comments: I am reccomending our place to all my Israeli frnd to visit & see the hospitality of our people.$$try & experience the diving in anilao thru pier uno dive resort...

message+desc:
Daraengi Rice Fields of Gacheon Village  

‚ÄúDaraengi‚Äù is ‚Äúdarangi,‚Äù in local dialect, which refers to the long and narrow terraced mountain rice fields. On June 14 to 15, the village will be holding the Daraengi Paddy Field Festival where visitors can take part in various programs related to the production of rice. The village is also one of the filming locations for the Korean drama "Cinderella's Stepsister."

message+desc:
Okay I did not expect this. Great job Lee Bee Wah! It may not have been intentional, but because of the statement, a lot of people are aware about our water situation now.We can all agreet the statement on apprecaiting water was one of the silliest things we've heard. But let's think about it for a second. Did it actually work?

We asked people on the street whether the 30% hike in water prices will make them appreciate water more.

The answers will surprise you.
comments:
No.
But it makes people adjust their lifestyle.
What used to be generosity becomes petty.
What used to be socialising becomes occasion.
What used to be sharing becomes mind the bill!
It further distances society and increases selfishness and aloofness...
Sad outcomes.$$To make us appreciate oxygen more we should pay for fresh air too. What a distorted theory.$$Cut the MP salary 30% to make them appreciate their HIGH PAY job !!!$$Many people think they don't waste water..but probably a lot of people will think they wasted their vote....during last election

message+desc:
A big, big thanks to the people who helped out during Typhoon Yolanda/Haiyan, like this Israeli soldier. Time to be grateful and be part of the Thank You movement by signing up at http://bit.ly/PHthankyou. Together, let's all thank the world at the same time on February 8, 2014!  

Shown here is a gesture called "Mano Po" -- a Filipino way of showing utmost respect and gratitude.  #PHthankyou

Photo from IDF Spokespersons Office

message+desc:
Embrace nature in summer to stay cool and comfortable!
‚ÄúKawadoko‚Äù are dining decks built above rivers in Kibune, in the northern part of Kyoto City. The surface of the water is so close that you can almost touch it, and you can enjoy the sounds of the river with your food and drink. 
Kifune Shrine http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/spot/shritemp/kifunejinja.html is within walking distance. Why not take a trip there this summer! 
Related Information: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/regional/kyoto/kurama.html

15 Abandoned Places In Singapore That Were Left For Dead

If you're interested in exploring corners rich in history and ghostly tales, this list is for you. 

I wouldn't step into #14 alone!

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/abandoned-placesIf you\'re interested in exploring corners rich in history and ghostly tales, this list is for you. I wouldn\'t step into #14 alone!
comments:
Neo Tiew estate. I went there twice in my life. First time is when I was 15. Was there because of a taoism precession. The next time I was there when I was 22. It was for military training. 

When I went back for military training. I felt so at home at first because the place is familiar to me. However I felt chill down my spine during the mid day, 12pm, for no reason. When I left the place at 4pm. I feel that there are a lot of eyes looking at us leaving.

Home of the ancient Baekje Kingdom, Buyeo-gun and Gongju-si in Chungcheongnam-do are all set for the 60th Baekje Cultural Festival   (Sep 26 to Oct 5).
Highlights include a massive LED media facade, falconry demonstrations, culture parade, fireworks, a lantern display, Hwangpo boat rides and much more!

message+desc:
Where is it?
Bais City, Negros Oriental

What is it?
The Central Azucarera de Bais was the first sugar mill in the Philippines, and a pioneer in making sugarcane paper. The island‚Äôs sugar industry reached its height in the 1930s. But the central is still fully functional.

Fun Fact:
73% of Bais City land is used for agriculture.

Photo by / Headline by:
Edel Sarmiento / Nikki Golez

message+desc:
Otari Village at the base of "the roof of Japan" or the northern Alps, is located in a portion of Hakuba Valley which is popular among many skiers. 
The 3 ski resorts in the village are the only place in the main island of Japan where you can enjoy high quality powder snow. The scenery and the culture of traditional snow country that still remain in the village are also worth seeing.

More story > http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/special_otarivillage.html

message+desc:
Kanchipuram - A spiritual and handicraft heritage that goes back for centuries

Kanchipuram, the golden city of a thousand temples, was once the capital of the Pallava dynasty. It is considered one of the seven sacred cities of India; some of the best temples were built here during the reign of the Pallavas between the 6th and 7th centuries. Subsequently, Kanchipuram also served as an important city of the far-flung empires of the Chola and the Vijayanagara dynasties.

Later, these dynasties too contributed greatly in the temple building activity of this town. 
The city has also been, through the years, a great seat of learning and culture. Adi Sankaracharya established his episcopal seat (Kamakodipeedam) here. Sri Sankaracharya, Appar, Siruthonder and the great Buddhist Bikshu, Bodhidharma, once lived and worked here. Today, it is known not only for temples but also for its hand-woven, silk fabrics. 

- See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/kanchipuram

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Club Paradise Resort, Palawan

What is it like? 
Club Paradise Resort is surrounded by a house reef which is easily accessible to divers and has a diverse marine system. Near this reef is the feeding ground of sea turtles and dugongs (sea cows) ‚Äì the gentle giants of the sea. There are tours that take you along the coast of Busuanga for some dugong-watching.

Fun Fact: 
Some believe that stories of mermaids came about when lonely sailors spotted dugongs swimming in the ocean, and mistook their shape as that of half-woman, half-fish creatures.

Photo by/Author: 
George Tapan/Tin Sanchez
comments: Mmmm looks sexy and serene$$Can't wait to get there!!!$$kalnggaman bato s palompon leyte.1 of the best ilsand ngyn. s aplompon leyte$$Raquel and I were there........beautiful!$$missing the philippines,its people and its food,cant wait to visit again,

Enjoy Variety of Onsen Hot Spring.

Today we introduce very popular Onsen area ‚ÄúOita‚Äù. Oita is a prefecture of onsen and it is located in the eastern part of Kyushu. The photo today is one of the hot springs called "hell springs" in Beppu. You will find many different colors and types of Onsen there. 

How about relaxing in Onsen? Onsen is not only for taking a bath but is a special traditional culture! You can enjoy real Japanese Onsen only in Japan. Come and visit once!

Oita Pref.
http://www.pref.oita.jp/english/climate/hotsprings.html

message+desc:
What is it?
The busiest place in the Philippines is underwater. It can get a bit crowded, but we like it that way. Visit Puerto Galera, Coron, Anilao, Boracay, Palawan, Dumaguete, Malapascua and Balicasag to meet our aquatic residents.

Fun Fact:
If you don‚Äôt want to get wet, visit Manila Ocean Park instead. It's a world-class marine theme park in the city.

Photo by / Headline by:
Gutsy Tuason / Rachel Teotico

message+desc: If you are a nature enthusiast or a lover of flowers, you need to take a trip along some of the fabulous rhododendron trails in India. During spring, between April and mid-May, the forest trails of the Himalayas are ablaze with a magnificent riot of colours - various hues of red, pink, yellow and white. Visit Brahmatal, the forests of Deoria Tal, or Bailey trail in #Arunachal Pradesh, and experience the surreal, awe-inspiring charm of the luscious Rhododendron forests.
comments: Also in Sikkim and other mountainous regions in India.

message+desc: Have you been to #Incheon or #Icheon? No, this is not a typo and there are truly two cities named 'Incheon' and 'Icheon' respectively. üòÇüòÇ  #Incheon s a metropolitan city by itself, with famous attractions including the airport, #Songdo new town, #chinatown, #Muido island, and more! On the other hand, #Icheon is a city in Gyeonggi Province and it is known for rice and ceramics. (y) if you'd like to know more cities with similar pronunciations! #KTO_Korean101

Can anyone tell is there a direct/express bus from Incheon airport to  Sokcho-si? Any different between Sokcho and Sokcho-si? I intend to go to mount seorak. 
How far is the Incheon Bus Terminal from Incheon airport?$$Christine, I believe there are two ways to get to Sokcho from Incheon Airport.  You can either go into Incheon city and take the bus, or go to Gangnam district in Seoul and take the bus.  I think going to Gangnam would be easier.  Take the airport limousine bus to Gangnam Bus Terminal, then either tak 4A or 10A bus to Sokcho.  Have a wonderful time in Seorak Mt.  It's a beautiful mountain, especially during the Fall.^^   $$I think the best way would be to take the cross country direct airport limousine (comfy, air conditioned) to the terminal in Gangneung. From there you can take the bus to Sokcho.

message+desc:
Because of its cooler climate and flocks of summer tourists, Baguio was named "Summer Capital of the Philippines". It is also popular for great pasalubongs (take home treats) such as fresh strawberries, peanut brittle, ube and choco flakes. Hurry though because the strawberry season ends in May.

Photo by Joe Galvez

message+desc:
Located in Thailand is a village that looks strikingly similar to Italy!

Unlike the usual night markets and crowded streets of Thailand, Palio Village is a breath of fresh air that looks nothing like what you're used to. Explore the Italian-themed village which has incredibly realistic decor and architecture, great for taking photos to trick your friends. There are also souvenir shops, fashion botiques, cafes and bakeries around for a day of shopping!

Address: 
146/1 Moo.4, Thanarath Road (km.17), Moo-si, Sub-District, Pakchong District, Nakornratchasima 30130

Find out more about Palio Village and Khao Yai here: http://thesmartlocal.com/read/khao-yai

Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com  and set Notifications to "All On"

Director: Adria Elysa Tham | Editor: Hoong Qi Rong | Model: Xenia Tan

message+desc:
Where is it?
Puerto Princesa, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly into Puerto Princesa from Busuanga, Cebu, Davao, Iloilo or Manila. 

What is it?
Sea anemones are known as "the flowers of the sea," and are named after the terrestrial flower of the same name. Beware ‚Äì their beauty is paired with a formidable bite, as the slightest touch on their tentacles triggers the release of a harpoon-like filament with painful neurotoxin.

Fun Fact:
While mobile, sea anemones are only capable of moving at three or four inches an hour.

Photo by / Headline by:
Tourism Department Philippines / Magnus Ahmad
comments: these are yellow sun corals not sea anemones$$I have been there and going back, Gods Land$$Can u bring me there Andrew Mendoza?$$The posted picture is the yellow sun coral.$$These are the sea anemones

message+desc:
Munnar - There is nowhere else quite like Munnar, and that is why so many travellers have a holiday in Munnar as top of their wish lists while travelleing to Kerala. Located at an altitude of 1600m, at the confluence of the Muthirappuzha, Chadavurai,   and  Kundaly rivers, it was once the summer resort of the British. 
Munnar  holds great appeal for those with an appreciative eye for exquisite beauty - from unending expanse of tea plantations to pristine valleys and the verdant mountains of the Western Ghats; and from national parks and sanctuaries teeming with wildlife, to the beautiful lakes.

 - See more at: http://www.incredibleindia.org/travel/destination/munnar
comments: beautiful place to visit and explore ...

Please remember this is just example. There are a lot of wonderful Japanese gardens everywhere in Japan.

These rice terraces may look like the ones up north but these are actually from Don Salvador Benedicto in Negros Occidental. Dubbed the ‚ÄúSummer Capital of Negros Occidental‚Äù due to its cool climate, this municipality also has a cave, a lake and several waterfalls worth exploring.

Share this shot with your travel buddies and make it a part of your 2016 list of places to visit! 

Photo by Jun Tiangja
comments:
Authorities and the people who promote this kind of landscapes, like by posting their pictures, must work together in safeguarding the integrity of the said landscape and preservation of the culture that created it. Never let the arrival of tourists harm these landscapes or their contact with the natives lure them (natives) away from rice planting.$$That rice terraces is I think in Barangay Bunga. And that was May dad's family rice terraces before but I think they sold it to some one. I miss being home! :($$I think more than half of Salvador Benedicto's land area are protected by DENR.$$I miss being in the Philippines all around.  I had a blast when I went.  Awesome pic.$$Have been in the Benguet  Terraces!

message+desc:
[$250 SUSHI GIVEAWAY!] What Ordering Food In Singapore May Look Like In 2030

It's hard to imagine using the internet on your phone was impossible 10 years ago. Over the next decade, things are going to get even more crazy.

To printing your own food and chicken rice being served to your HDB 12 stories in the air, this may be the future in 2030.

Prove that you're an InDIYpendent Singaporean and win 5 x $50 Genki Sushi vouchers! All you'll have to do is:

1. Like and share THIS post
2. Comment here on how technology has made life more flexible.

Contest ends 15 July 2016. The most creative entries will win. Good luck!

http://thesmartlocal.com/read/ordering-food-futureFrom drone deliveries to 3D food printing, find out how else our eating habits will change by the time year 2030 rolls around!

Congratulations Cecilia Chng, Muhammad Arif, Sharon Yokaco, Tan Bee Chin Joyce, Wei KC!  You've all been picked as winners for this giveaway. Please PM us with your Full Name (as in NRIC), last 4 characters of NRIC (Sxxxx123A), and we'll get back to you shortly!$$Gone are the days of writting long letters. Today, technology has made it possible to send message across literally with just a finger touch. The most important documents and communications are digitally sent across the world and are delivered within seconds. Facebook is one of them, it helps to make the world more open and connected. Technology is the force behind it. Now this is what you call making life easier and flexible.$$Due to the amazing advances in technology over the last 10 years, a lot of us now have access to variety in almost every aspect of our lives. If we need a ride, there is no need to stand by a roadside waiting for a cab or to call a cab. Now we whip out our phones and within a few presses a cab comes to us, through apps like Grab, Uber, and even Ryde. We dont have to go to travel agencies and ask which hotel is the best. We just go on Expedia or AirBnB to find accomodation that suits us best. All these examples really reflect how flexible our lives have become because of technology.$$Internet banking has made my life easier by being able to pay my bills before the clock strikes 12mn, so that I won't be liable for late fees! I can even make recurring or post dated payments.

Esther L Chng Joy Yeo$$My midnight craving during pregnancy for Macdonald allows me to easily order it and no need to trouble my poor hubby to drive down in middle of night to buy it.

we need technology to enhance efficiency !

Annie Tan-Yeo$$#WeAreInDIYpendent #FastEasyFlexible DIY machine are great, they have helped us to reduce waiting/queuing time. When ATM machine and AXS first came out it was a great help in reducing waiting time and make life easier and more efficient and as times goes by, technology improve and we now have mobile AXS apps on our phone. This is DIY 2.0, it is an evolution from the standalone DIY machine and has make life even easier for us as we can use it anytime, anywhere.
I am waiting for the day my mobile banking apps can let me withdraw and deposit cash, i believe that day will come$$As an 18 year old man / boy / guy / student, technology has vastly improved my life. 
First of all, lets talk food. Applications like foodpanda, deliveroo, mcdelivery , ect has made ordering of food through calls a thing from the past . We can order food so easily now,  by just tapping, swiping, ordering and paying . " Hardworking" and "busy" students like me don't have to waste time , going to a hawker centre or fastfood restaurants to queue and wait for food now . There are even apps like Honestbee and RedMart  , that delivers groceries to our homes. 
Secondly , we have applications like zalora , cotton on , sephora , that allows us to order fashion items back to our homes without travelling. We can even buy gifts for our friends through apps like these . Its fast , easy and definitely it has made our lives more flexible . 
There are so many things i can say about technology , though it has it's downs , the ups greatly overthrows them . It's 1:36 am and I have school tomorrow , so imma go now . HAHA i hope i can win those vouchers , cuz i really wanna eat sushi :< And i would love to intern at THESMARTLOCAL.COM ( Sings the theme song ) But i would save that talking for another day :)$$Technology has made life much more flexible in so many different aspects; messaging applications have bridged the gaps between us and have allowed us to connect to one another and share more of our personal lives with each other on the go, real time, even when we're physically apart. Mobile applications have also made it possible for us to pick up languages and other skills during those bus rides & MRT rides, turning self-improvement in our packed school/work lives from a fairy tale to reality. :) With all this advancement of technology, we are now more inspired to further technology, and imagine a better, more flexible future for ourselves. :)$$Liked and shared

I am a InDIYpendent Singaporean in overseas too. I remembered during my last customer visit in Shanghai.
