As a InDIYpendent, I simply place my cake orders from a portal and they delivered to my hotel. So simple. No sweat.$$The advanced in technology has made travelling a less-hassle, enjoy our favourite food as and when we want and also time-saving when it comes to shopping and grocery buying. This was not even possible 5 years ago and we can see how fast technology has progress to enable us to lead a fuss-free life. What i envision in 2030 to be more convenient and faster than the current technology just like those in superheroes movie XD$$1. Like and share THIS post
2. Technology has made life more flexible. We can now order food online and have it delivered to our homes. Video Chat with family from oversea. It is like they are just next to us. And we no longer need to go to the library or book store to get the books we love. Just dowload the ebook for your reading pleasure anywhere and any time.$$The convenience technology has provided us can be felt not just by customers, but also by those working in the f&b line. Taking of orders used to be by paper and pen, which is not just troublesome and time consuming, and order papers could be easily lost or destroyed. But now with technology, we can easily key in the orders into the cashier and immediately both service and kitchen would have machines churning out the orders without mistake through wireless internet. And now customers can get their food and be happy B| 
(liked and shared~)$$technology has made life more flexible in three ways. 
one, when i am stuck in a deserted toilet with no toilet paper i no longer have to use my socks or wait 300 years for someone to come, i can just call someone with my handphone to come down with supplies.
two, when i am the loner at the party i no longer have to stare around awkwardly, i can whip out my phone and pretend i have a life and so many people are messaging me oh gosh.
three, when i see all the cool new phones and lappies i gotta catch em all so technology has given me new and innovative ways to become a poor and bankrupt student.$$Long long time ago when I was in my late teens and early twenties, I have many friends who broke up because one partner is going overseas to study. A few more years down the road came msn then Skype and now FaceTime. If they are born in this era, they wouldn't need to break up la. They have the flexibility to video call on PC/ Laptop or FaceTime/message/call using various phone apps. Technology have saved many ‚ù§Ô∏èrelationships‚ù§Ô∏è.$$Liked & shared! Technology make my life wonderful and handphone is the best invention. Handphone is a great companion, a BFF. Whenever I feel bored, I can play games with it, watch movies with it and listen music with it. My life becomes colourful and all my troubles are waived off.$$Liked & shared! Technology make my life more flexible and convenient when I am hungry and need for food I can simply call for delivery without even stepping out of my house! I can contact my friends with Watapp on mobile phone and stay in touch with friends through Facebook and messenger! No more letter writing which take time to reach my friends save on paper and effortlessly to stay in touch! Tagging Jennifer Ong Boon Chye$$I love how technology allows and helps me in communicating with people on the other side of the world. I would look forward to every night as i would be able to video call my mom as she moved to Thailand. We would talk about everything and anything HAHAHA it almost felt like we were side by side and things were the same like when i was a little kid. I am kind of an awkward potato andddddd im an introvert. I used to bury my head in books and not socialize with people of my age but playing online games has helped me out tremendously as it made me feel comfortable talking to strangers and connect with people from other parts of the world. From chatting behind a computer screen and slowly to video chatting with my best friend from maplestory. She has helped me to become a more social person and made me feel comfortable in my skin because I was made fun of alot in school and was an outcast. But, she was there for me and I would always look forward to going home and pouring my emotions out to her. She was a good listener. She taught me to create a blog and let me share about my life experiences. I'm so glad technology was invented and really glad that i have met my first true friend :)$$Technology has made life so much more flexible in so many ways. Communication is one of the aspects that have become much more convenient. Previously, once the date and time have been fixed, it is hard to change it at the very last minute. With smartphones, we can now create group chats and update everyone on the date and time to meet with a simple message. Also, it has allowed many cross-border exchanges, be it travelling or business deals, and strangers, friends and even families are able to connect despite being in different countries.

Liked and shared the post! :)$$I remember when we used to enter contests by tearing out pages from magazines/newspapers and mailing them by postage to the company's office, and we receive our prize through mailing too! Now with technology, we just need to "like and share" and most of the prizes are e-vouchers which is convenient! :)$$Press a button, money transfer over. Press another button food flies over. So shiok! We are very fortunate to be living in this era, everything got shortcuts now. Heng ah! I'm sure in the years ahead, we will see revolutionary changes in the way we lead our lives. Look forward to more exciting developments in the next generation of technological advancements. Hope I can still keep up with it in my 60s, 70s... :) Our lives will be more intertwined with technology!$$Technology has made my life easier and more convenient. From online banking to online shopping to ordering your taxi from your smart device. All it takes is a push of a button and sometimes you may not even have to own a credit card to enjoy having everything sent to your doorstep. Yes, some shops accepts COD! :-) But what I love most about these modern conveniences is that I get to spend more time with my kids and husband. The time supposed to be spent in walking to Sheng Siong and hauling 30 kilos of grocery with 2 howling kids in tow is now better spent playing catch in the park or watching movies at home with my feet propped up. Other than that, I am on extended maternity leave because I can work from home and submit my reports online. How cool is that? Perhaps I will order that chicken rice from that flying boat after all. Kristina OngDee Kaytee Polyndevilla Vic Peng$$Technology has definitely made life more flexible by allowing me to order fast food like MacDonald's, Pizza Hut, KFC etc with the click of my hand. It totally helps when I stranded at home with 2 little ones. 

Liked n shared!$$As Singaporeans, we love our food as much as we love our choices. With the advancements in technology, not only has our food become more delicious, dining has become more fun as well.

For instance, many would agree that having sushi off the conveyor belt not only allows us to dine at our own pace, the myriad of choices is also part of the fun. 

Having Korean BBQ wouldn't be as fun if the meat came to your table properly grilled as opposed to cooking it to your desired doneness, thanks to technology that makes it possible for diners to grill the meat and eat it right after.

And what about designing your own fluffy pancakes from bottles of pre-coloured pancake batter? 

All these dining experiences would not have been possible if technology did not exist - no longer do we need to prepare food beforehand before sitting down to a meal with friends or family - with technology, even the cooking can be an activity that bonds people.

We cannot deny that the future of food is closely linked with the advancement in technology. After all, one day we may be able to have our meals in a self-driving vehicle while taking in the beautiful scenery - life does not get more flexible than that. ;)$$Technology made our lives easier by allowing us to read almost everything and anywhere via our smartphones, so now I can just read stories and articles (esp thesmartlocal articlea :P) on the go!

Bangon Pilipinas!International travel organizations have expressed readiness to support the Philippines in any tourism-related recovery program for areas ravaged by the recent calamity.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Siargao, Surigao del Norte

What is it like? 
The Philippines isn‚Äôt a major surf destination yet. That means more waves for you. We recommend hitting the beaches of Siargao, the country's surfing capital. Its popular surfing points have interesting names: Jack Horse, Quiksilver and the famous Cloud 9 ‚Äî known for its thick, perfect hollow tubes. It‚Äôs only been a few decades since American surf enthusiasts brought their boards to the Philippines, but our beaches have really taken to surf culture. As they should. They‚Äôve got water and waves to spare.

How to get there: 
Fly from Manila to Surigao (one hour), then take a boat to Siargao.

Or take a bus from Manila or Davao to Surigao, then take a boat to Siargao.

Or take a boat from Manila to Surigao, then take a boat to Siargao.

Fun Fact: 
International surfers call Cloud 9's perfect tubes as "the special wave." The wave was discovered by traveling surfers in the late 1980s. It was named and made famous by American photographer John S. Callahan.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Donna Dimayuga

The last time I was there my driver would only take me to San Juan on the south china  sea side of the Philippines$$I want to get there so very badly

 Then, this is the place for you!

message+desc:
"They all" say you will get caught for eating and drinking on the bus, but knowing that's false now shouldn't turn us into inconsiderate commuters.There is no law against eating and drinking on the bus. That's a fact.

But should we do it? Of course not.

https://mustsharenews.com/eat-drink-buses/
comments:
Hah! Someone needs to educate the bus captains then. I used to take 855 from Yishun to Bt Merah every morning and to save time, would bring a bun for breakfast. I was always discreet, never littering, and most of the time, no one cared. One particular bus driver would not only shout at you, but if you didn't realise he was talking to you, would actually take the time while at a bus stop to walk all the way to the back to reprimand you for eating.$$You can treat the bus as a cafeteria so long as you don't welcome ants as passengers by dropping the bread crumbs. 

Also water and sweets are acceptable in the train. It will be cruel to leave someone thirsty in the train, and sweets are too small to make the train dirty$$Nice nice. I once saw someone opened a pack of economical noodle that smell so good right behind me on the bus. 
I'd like to invite anyone to join me for a durian and jackfruit fiesta in the bus.$$In the 90s, there used to be a no food and drink sign on the bus and there is indeed a penalty.  Currently these signs have been removed.$$As with all things in life, even if it's permissible be considerate in shared places.$$Once a bus driver who wasn't on duty ate fried rice and fried chicken in a container of course IN THE BUS BESIDE ME. Wow!$$Benji Tan NEED TO TAG YOU FOR THIS LOL

about an hour ago ¬∑ 
An Appeal to the United Nations from a former Filipino Delegate to the United Nations General Assembly

I am Michael Francis Acebedo Lopez, a Filipino and a former delegate to the United Nations General Assembly. Nearly ten years before the questionable rise of one Leni Robredo to the Philippine Vice Presidency, I had the honor of representing my country, the Philippines, as the youngest Filipino delegate to the United Nations General Assembly in its history. I also had the opportunity to be the Philippines‚Äôs first actual Youth Representative or Delegate, a partial fulfillment of our commitment to the UN‚Äôs World Programme of Action for Youth or WPAY. 

UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon accepted my letter of credential signed by the Philippine Foreign Minister. There it was stated that I was attending the General Assembly ‚Äúas Adviser to the Third Committee Plenary Session on Social Development, including questions relating to the World Social Situation and to Youth, Ageing, Disabled Persons and the Family.‚Äù In the august halls of the UN World Headquarters in New York, I also had the honor to draft and deliver the Philippine Statement to the General Assembly‚Äôs Third Committee. 

In light of Vice President Robredo‚Äôs video message to the UN Commission on Narcotic Drugs posted on TIME Magazine‚Äôs website and shared by various media organizations, I am recalling the mandate I was once given in an effort to reach out to all of you, member states of the UN and all organizations within the UN System. If said mandate is not sufficient because it has long since lapsed, I am hinging my appeal therefore on my being a natural born citizen of one of only four Asian nations who signed the 1945 Charter that created the United Nations. 

I am making this urgent appeal on behalf of each and every Filipino grossly misrepresented by our a Vice President in said video message, a Vice President whose own mandate has been called into question, with the highest electoral tribunal of the land, the Presidential Electoral Tribunal, having considered the election protest against her win to be sufficient in both form and substance. 

With unfounded claims and unsubstantiated allegations, Vice President Robredo wantonly painted an impossibly grim image of the Philippine situation if only to attract international attention and action. To say that she delved in speculation is understating the gravity of her made-up claims and the severity of the damage she has caused on our country and our people in so doing. In reporting to the world what she failed to report to Philippine authorities, assuming there are actual reports received by the Office of the Vice President, she has not only embarrassed our country, she has betrayed the public trust and committed economic sabotage, both punishable under Philippine laws. 

For her to say that ‚Äúour people feel both hopeless and helpless‚Äù is a brazen lie. Confidence in the presidency is at an all time high (while the same cannot be said of the vice president whose approval ratings continue to plummet); as a people, we feel hopeful and empowered like we‚Äôve never felt before. 

Please understand that at the heart of this is destructive party politics. It is the Vice President‚Äôs party flexing its muscles to overthrow a duly elected government so they may once more regain control of government. Perhaps she feels time is running out for her because of developments in the Presidential Electoral Tribunal. So she and her allies have launched an expensive campaign using human rights and the War on Drugs as their excuse to bait the world into interfering in our domestic issues. 

When the Vice President says 7,000 people have been killed in the President‚Äôs War on Drugs, she fails to mention that this is set against the backdrop of around 700,000 to one million successful arrests and surrenders. So the figure she presents to you is not even one percent. And surely with the sheer number of those involved in the illicit drug trade, some police operations see suspects resisting arrest and fighting back and the police having to defend themselves resulting in casualties. Every war has casualties. It is not a perfect war and I‚Äôm certain there have been abuses along the way, and these need to be looked into and those responsible must be brought to justice. But exaggerating things does not help at all. 

In asking for the international community, the UN, to intervene, she uses the issue of human rights. Let us then talk about human rights. 

In responding to the call of Robredo, the international community must tread carefully lest it encroaches on our very sovereignty and our right to self-determination. And as a sovereign state, we have determined to wage an internal war (not a war against another nation) against the evils of drugs, a direction affirmed by our democratic processes when President Duterte who included the War on Drugs as one of his main programs of action, received an overwhelming mandate during the May 2016 Presidential Election. In short, the War on Drugs, by extension, has the people‚Äôs mandate. 

Any effort to disturb our democracy and sovereignty as a response to the Vice President‚Äôs irresponsible and unfounded claims will subvert the will of the Filipino people and violate our Human Right of Suffrage enshrined in both the Philippine Constitution and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (Article 21 of the international covenant). 

Once again, I am making this appeal to all member states of the United Nations and all organizations within the UN System to disregard the Philippine Vice President‚Äôs statement which is, I reiterate, a grave misrepresentation of the prevailing sentiments of our people and a gross perversion of the facts surrounding the War on Drugs. 

To my fellow Filipinos, let us remain vigilant in the face of threats to our democracy by the very people who claim to defend it. Ako po‚Äôy nanawagan na i-share ang video na ito upang ito ay umabot sa UN at sa iba‚Äôt ibang foreign governments. 

Maraming salamat. Thank you and good evening.

message+desc:
Khajuraho - Eternal Expressions of Love

The temples of Khajuraho are India's unique gift to the world, representing, as they do, a paean to life, to love, to joy, perfect in execution and sublime in expression. Life, in every form and mood, has been captured in stone, testifying not only to the craftsman's artistry but also to the extraordinary breadth of vision of the Chandela Rajputs under whose rule the temples were conceived and constructed. The Khajuraho temples were built in the short span of a hundred years, from 950-1050 AD in truly inspired burst of creativity. Of the 85 original temples, 22 have survived till today to constitute one of the world's great artistic wonders. 

- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/khajuraho
comments:
The carvings are in excellent condition  considering they are over a thousand years old. message+desc:
Amritsar - Seat of Sikh faith, history and culture
----------------------------------------------------------------------

Amritsar, literally a Pool of Nectar, derives its name from Amrit Sarovar, the holy tank that surrounds the splendid Golden Temple. Guru Ramdas, the fourth Guru of the Sikh faith, founded Amritsar in 1579. He constructed a pool on land gifted by the Mughal Emperor Akbar and called it Amritsar. 

Home to the world famous Golden Temple, the 400-year-old city of Amritsar is the most important seat of Sikh history and culture. 

One of the most poignant memorials of free India -- Jallianwala Bagh ‚Äì is also located in the city. Amritsar district was once a part of the vast area covered by the Indus valley Civilisation during the early period of history. 

- See more at: http://incredibleindia.org/index.php/travel/destination/amritsar
comments: Amritsar - Where faith,reside's in the Heart.$$http://youtu.be/TbNBn5krZzo$$Katie Scarlett Coan: remember I mentioned this?

message+desc:
Lavender belongs to a group of herbs that are native to the coastal area of the Mediterranean Sea.
However, they can be seen in Japan! The climate of Furano, Hokkaido allows for a number of lavender fields to spread throughout the region, making it the perfect symbol for the Furano area. 
The flowers are generally in full bloom from mid-June to late July.
Why not visit Furano and be healed by a field of lavender?

Related Information: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/hokkaido/furano.html

message+desc: 11.11 It's #PeperoDay in #Korea today! For those who are new to this #KoreanCulture, peperos are simply chocolate covered cookie sticks. Have you seen them during your #VisitKorea? Let us know which is YOUR favorite #pepero flavor! :p
comments:
Farmer's day or Pepero's day ...just a day for getting people together and to have fun too...so why worries? I love hazelnut pepero...I will catch u there next month...pepero...am coming$$..i wanna share my experience the day before the pepero day, it was 1:30am last November 10. 

Me and my friend got lost in seoul. We are both Filipinos and it was the first day of our vacation, so expect us to forget our way out of the subway. Haha. Yes, because of excitement we forgot to remember the station and the exit near our guesthouse. We got the last trip to seoul station that night and we walk back and forth to the exits to remember our way out until our feet and legs got very tired. We decided to go out of one station and ask someone for directions but no one can understand english well and also they didnt know where is our address(we also asked someone in the reception of a school and he told us that we are far from our address) We are in doubt of his direction because as far as i remember i actually said to my friend that we are not near yongsan station but seoul station on our first ride on the subway so i am really in doubt of what he said. But because we are hopeless that night we bought tickets to yongsan station just to get home. But our doubt is so big that we decided to go out again of the seoul station and find our way home. While walking on the streets my friend suddenly called someones attention, we asked him if he know our address (we show him our guesthouse reservation) and he responded that we are on seoul and our address is in yongsan that is very far from our current location. He started to find our way through google maps and showed us the distance and it is actually really far. We insisted that our address is near seoul station but we cannot remember where in seoul. He search again and again on google maps and we can feel that he dont believe us until he asked us if we trust him. I said of course we trust him (because he looks trust worthy and we are hopeless that time). So he asked us to follow him (yes, he really guide us to our guesthouse). Near our guesthouse i can feel the happiness (of course because we found our way home and we can now rest). We didnt know how to thank him. I asked him if there is something that we can do to thank him and he just said "no, its pepero day tomorrow. Do you know pepero day?" and i said "yes" and he lend us his box of krispy kreme and said "this is for you, tomorrow is pepero day" (i didnt remember everything that he said but it was like pepero day is a day of helping, sharing and love. At first i did not accept his krispy kreme because i am ashamed of him (he helped us find our way home and now giving us a box of donuts) because it is too much for us but he insisted so we end up accepting it. All we can say that time to him is thank you so much again and again. We are very thankful because he passed through us when we our hopeless. We dont need his donuts, his kindness is too much for us. His name is Tong Kwon. We are very thankful that we met him. :)$$Yes I love PAPERO....Next Autumn I m going to Korea...but my concern is #HALAL food. http://issuu.com/takosdiary/docs/octopepero/1

Happy #PeperoDay to fellow #VisitKorea fans out there as well as Korea Tourism Organization - VisitKorea staff <3 :*$$When i see pepero, it reminds about handsome boy, haha exo ^^$$Erin it's a whole day devoted to poky sticks! It's HUGE in Korea.$$H Min Park~ gwapo..haha..i want this for christmas..hahaha...joke..$$Melon and strawberry..but cant get it last month when was in korea.üò≠üò≠$$Kimballina Seelua Unni have fun with Peperos today!!!$$Caroline Hannah Luu! On the second day of every New Year, some Japanese people do ‚ÄúKakizome‚Äù, which translates literally as ‚Äúthe first writing‚Äù. 
This traditional Japanese calligraphy event will be held at Tenmangu shrines in various regions such as the Kitano Tenmangu in Kyoto, the Hofu Tenmangu in Yamaguchi, the Dazaifu Tenmangu in Fukuoka, and more.
Would you like to give it a try as well? 
https://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/spot/shritemp/kitanotenmangu.html 
https://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/spot/shritemp/hofutenmangu.html 
https://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/spot/shritemp/dazaifutenmangu.html 
Related Information;
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1409_taiken.html

message+desc:
When we heard a supper place with Salted Egg Yolk and Chilli Crab Prata existed, we had to check it out. It opens till 3am!

More pictures & review here: http://eatbook.sg/big-street-review/

Situated in a 2.5-storey shophouse at Jalan Besar that can sit up to 100 people, Big Street serves up creative prata dishes like Salted Egg Prata, Chicken Mushroom Prata and Chilli Crab Prata Coins! The food is pricey but the uniqueness of this place makes the price worth it.

Address: 104/106 Jalan Besar, S208828
Opening Hours: 11am to 3am
Verdict: 8/10

Never want to miss a post by us again?
Like TheSmartLocal.com FB Page > Click on "Liked" and set Notifications to "All On"

This is part of our undercover review series.

Model: Symone Oei
comments:
Just visited. Nice ambience, free wifi, TVs all over, kids corner was a nice touch. 

Ordered the dinner set, after some time asked them when's the food coming and they asked "so what drink did you order?" I know Jia Lat Liao. When the food came bak ku teh soup was not hot, satay was ok, ice holicks was diluted, hot holicks was ok, after about an hour I'm still waiting for my nasi briyani. Service speed is like 1/10. Maybe teething issues. But don't come hungry. You'll die of hunger before your food appears.

Update, briyani still mia. Kitchen didn't prepare. Cancelled my order, owner wanted to charge me 2 drinks and a scoop of ice cream. Half way keying in said he won't charge anything. Funny thing is walk past the kitchen the staff were all standing around doing nothing.$$the Indian in me is calling out blasphemy, but looks like a shiok leh$$disgustingly horrid place with effing' bad service with China waitresses who dont even know what they are serving. no crowd yet food took 20 mins to come with multiple wrong orders like almost 5times. had like 8 or maybe more waiters over there but no crowd yet all acting busy and no one bothers to give you the menu or to seat you either. 
took the wrong order and they didnt even bother to ask what was the correct order and just walked off leaving us with no order. really OMG. dont bother trying seriously. SERVICE SUCKS SHIT!$$Went there already, portion quite small and a bit ex.  Prata texture not as good as expected, still have dough not cooked enough.  Chilli crab sauce normal, salted egg prata normal.  Mushroom chicken prata dom not bad but price and taste compared to a mushroom chicken pie elsewhere, it lose out.  Ice cream and waffle was ok.  Overall speed for food poor.$$Is the model or blogger even genuine about her comments for the food served? Food is not served hot. Gave wrong order even when we ordered from tablet. Food is just average but pricey. Only good thing we had here was the french fries with cheese, 10 bucks for it though. 

Sad to say but really upset with my experience. Never gonna visit here again I guess.$$I went there today after seeing this post. 

NOT IMPRESSED. 

The soup with the garlic stick was good, but the soup was luke warm. 
The chilli wrap was not too bad, but serving was a tad small. 
We also had the mushroom chicken prata bomb, which, to be honest, you might hafta put a gun to my head before I pay for it again. 
We waited 15mins for it, and the fillings were Luke warm, and it tasted horrid. 
The lemon tea was nice, albeit a tad too sweet 

We left the place filling hungry after paying 35 dollars 

At least now I know not to trust everything I see on FB. :)$$Blogger is paid to write a positive review even how fcked up the food and service. Nothing beats the classic original Indian prata with spicy curry fish!$$It's an awesome place with great food and pleasant ambience. I can just sit there the whole day, eat, drink, meet friends and study. Love Big Street! More importantly, the cook always prepares special vegetarian dish for me. Very happy and grateful. üëç$$Went there for lunch, no comments about service. It was okay. But the food was terrible, sad to say. Might have been the indian in me, but the curry was like water(?) the chilli crab was more like ketchup and the pratas were just meh
Theres better prata for less than half the price outside$$Went on a week day lunch so no crowds at all.. Food was so so .. Honestly a little pricey for the average standard ..the briyani reminded me of my army days. Can go just for ambience .$$Disappointed with their service too! Went there sometime in July, walked in and was told fully booked for dinner & that was it. Service ended there & we just walked out. Won't go back anymore$$Wow, so many bad review abt tis cafe. I guess the cafe actually paid smartlocal to do a "FAKE" review so tat it will attract more crowds. So disappointed in tis kind of sponsored review.$$Hope it's Halal certified....üëçmore people will come over with friends and family..
Cos it's looks so awesome üòäüòÅ$$Hilary Roselle this is the one im talking about! But then the reviews like not worth.... Should we just go try someplace else? üòõ$$Just don't go there any more . Unbelievable . Why bother to open a restaurant and then run it into the ground with indifference ?$$With so many negative reviews, maybe I should skip the place.$$Rayyan Mifzal I'm adding this to the list of places we'll never go$$Cedric Chng think I will puke if I ever see a salted egg again$$Isaac Fong this is taking the salted egg fad a tad too far. message+desc:
Do you know the name for the 10th month in the traditional Japanese calendar?
It called ‚ÄúKANNAZUKI Á•ûÁÑ°Êúà‚Äù, literally meaning is "the month when there are no gods".
According to the ancient mythology, it is said that 8 million gods (Shintoism) of Japan gathered together annually at Izumo Taisha Grand Shrine (in Shimane prefecture) on the 10th month of the year. So only in this region the 10th month was called ‚ÄúKAMIARIZUKI Á•ûÂú®Êúà‚Äù, the month with gods.
 
Izumo Taisha Grand Shrine is well known for a god of matchmaking and many people who wish to find a spouse are visiting this shrine throughout the year.
 
Please check the myth of this sacred place and visit.
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/cultural/pilgrimage/izumo.html
Izumo, Home of the Gods: Kingdom Inheritance Mythology 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1B7v8ysv6v8
Related Information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/shimane/izumo.html
comments:
I've been there!!! Nice place!!!$$I want to visit there again$$I wish I can fly to be there..........cross fingers$$japan is awesome country !!!$$I wish I could go there to find spouse for me!$$I visited Izumo in March 2014 (sakura), it was awesome! 
Without any doubt I can say that Japan is the most beautiful country. Not only for the landscapes but also for the Japanese culture.$$It's spelled 8 million in Kanji, but it doesn't mean so.$$visited last august, with my daughter.  
Izumo Taisha vice priest married Imperial family this month.  Happy!

message+desc:
Kairaku-en garden (Ibaraki Pref.) is well-known for the sight of plum trees . About 3, 000 plum trees are at their best until the end of March, and great number of tourists come to see the garden. 
This garden is established in 1842, Edo era, by Shogun (a general) Nariaki Tokugawa. It has been popular as scenic and historical spot so far with not only the local residents but tourists from domestic and abroad.
Ume Matsuri (Plum trees Festival) is held till 31st. March,  let's check this out!!
For more informationÔºöhttp://www.koen.pref.ibaraki.jp/foreign_language/en/guide_map/index.html
comments: beautiful blooms! been there yesterday and the weather was perfect. more trees are yet to bloom. :D

message+desc:
Where is it?
Ternate, Cavite

How to Get There:
Take a bus to Cavite from Cubao or Pasay.

What is it?
It only takes a day to hike Mt. Pico de Loro. Though it's only 664 meters above sea level, the trail to the summit is difficult, but rewarding. Nestled in Ternate, it offers a view of mountainous landscapes and nearby islands. The best part is it‚Äôs only three hours away from Manila.

Fun Fact:
During the Spanish era, Mount Pico de Loro was a Filipino rebel‚Äôs camp and watch tower.

Photo by / Headline by:

message+desc:
Here is the scene of beautiful powdery snow from Ginzan hot spring, located in Yamagata prefecture of Tohoku district!

Looks cold? Don't worry, you can warm up your body in a hot spring while watching snowfalls.
It's so nice to bath in a hot spring when it's getting dark and the streetlamps are on!

If you're planning to visit Tokyo, why don't you drop by the Tohoku district? You'll get there in 3 hours by bullet train.

For more information, check out our website!
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/routes/rtp/index.html

message+desc:
Today‚Äôs photo is a procession of women in traditional attire parades. 
This festival called Aizu-Tajima Gion Matsuri, which takes place at Minami Aizu Town in Fukushima Prefecture.
On July 22nd, Kodomo-Kabuki (traditional Japanese plays by children) is performed on the floats set in the center of the town from 12 noon to 1 pm.
And the following day, July 23rd, there is a Nanahokai-Gyoretsu (procession of women parade like a photo below) from 7 am to 8:30 am.
It would be a great idea to include Aizu area in your itinerary, if you have a chance to visit on July.

Related Information;
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/fukushima/aizukougen.html
comments: Do love japanese culture and tradition$$Beautiful ladies with beautiful Kimonoes.$$a good culture and tradition that I ever find$$https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1psm99mIA70

message+desc: This stunning photo of the San Juanico Bridge was shared to us by Ato Rosario. The San Juanico Bridge is the longest bridge in the Philippines and connects the two provinces of Samar and Southern Leyte. Connections. More Fun in the Philippines! The San Juanico Bridge, is an arch-shaped truss bridge in the Philippines stretching from Samar to Leyte crossing the San Juanico Strait. It is part of the Pan-Philippine Highway. It is the longest bridge in the Philippines spanning a body of water with a length of 2.16 kilometers (1.34 mi) . It is considered one of the most beautifully-designed bridges in Philippines, having been designed by renowned architect Juanito Isko Balunbalu , a once obscure architect from Tacloban City until the completion of the bridge and the fame for which it was later known. The bridge is supported by 43 spans rising 41 meters above the sea. It has a large arch beneath which allows boats to pass. It was designed by engineer Arvin Valderama and Christian Meynard Barnal and constructed over San Juanico Strait from Cabalawan, Tacloban City to the municipality of Santa Rita, Samar in 1969. It was completed in 1973.
comments: Been there crossed the bridge both ways with my extended family. A beautiful part of Leyte.$$Thanks "The Philippines" for sharing my photo. This is my first visit in Tacloban and i'm so happy that weather was perfect for some photographs. I myself was in awe when i saw this beautiful bridge. Mabuhay ang Pilipinas!  ;) $$One of the projects of Pres. Ferdinand Emmanuel E. Marcos

Where is it?
Bacolod City, Visayas

How to Get There:
"Fly from Manila or Cebu to Bacolod.

Or take a bus from Dumaguete to Bacolod.

Or take a boat from Manila to Bacolod."

What is it?
Known as the Festival of Smiles, Masskara started as a way of uplifting the spirits of the people of Bacolod.

Fun Fact:
Electric Masskara, a three-day portion of the three-week long celebration, is the longest street party in the country.

Photo by / Headline by:
Izah Morales / Rachel Teotico

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Batanes, Luzon

What is it like? 
The ten islands of Batanes are among the northernmost places in the Philippines. They have very unique topography, where green pastures merge with a contrasting white shoreline. Chadpidan Beach, Sabtang Beach and Nakabuang Beach are the most popular ones.

Fun Fact: 
The islands lie in a strait between the Philippines and Taiwan. Turn on a transistor radio and you'll pick up signals from Taiwanese radio stations!

Photo by/Author: 
Rommel Natanauan/Jao Bautista

we love so much this place many inspiring for us so many colours like our life.

 #MyVisitKoreaStory$$#MyVisitKoreaStory from July 2016 is a different kind of travel story because it is not about nature, the grand palaces or the unique food in Korea. This photo is inside the venue of a concert I attended in the Olympic Stadium. It was a very memorable experience to be joining the fan chants while EXO performs. During this trip I also got to know fans from U.S., Australia, Japan and France and knowing that Korean pop music has inspired them enough too to make a trip to Seoul. This trip made me see the intense K-pop culture of the youth while still being friendly towards foreign fans. This was a very different trip for me because I used to make trips to immerse myself into Korea's nature, busy shopping streets, art cafes and grand palaces. This was a trip that made me closer to my fandom and also fulfilled my wish of watching my favorite K-pop group right there in their home country. Truly, a beautiful memory I will always keep with me.$$My first trip to Korea with my daughter's! It was a dream come true. I was born in Korea and went back when I was little. I wanted to go back with my mother but she passed away in 2008. I always told my daughter's that we would go to Korea and it finally happened this year.  It would be awesome to go back and see the rest of the country of my mother. #MyVisitKoreaStory  May 2016$$#MyVisitKoreaStory Having to immerse in their local culture I decided to try out their street food stalls which is really fun. Seeing the friendly lady cooking for me and the grilled aromatic of the fresh seafood and meat just simply makes my stomach growling really loud which lucky the Locals beside me are too busy chatting away.$$Photo was taken when autumn season in November 2015 that was my last day for trip of korea. Feel like at home. I am fall in love with korea at the first sight when i saw a drama Autumn in My Heart. This country is so beautiful and makes me always wanna go there. I will waiting for my lovely Knight and go back there to lock our love forever.
#NamsanSeoulTower
#MyVisitKoreaStory$$I am from Indonesia, a tropic country where it has only two seasons: dry season and wet season. Therefore, I have a dream willing to experience other seasons like spring, winter and autumn in different country. Then I choose South Korea for my autumn experience. Here, I went there on last October 2015. I visited Soeraksan and Nami Island. Those places were fullfiled with yellow ginkgo and red maple trees where the leaves falling everywhere. It was definitely beautiful. I never see maple and ginkgo before because they doesn't grow in Indonesia, and finally I touched them. Love it! #MyVisitKoreaStory$$I want to participate this event. I has uploaded my photo not sure that I'm do it the correct way or not cos I didn't see my post at Korea Tourism Organization webpage, kindly let me know I'm successful posted.$$Samcheongdong Hanok definitely caught my attention the moment I stepped on there. That place is simply picturesque and while in pictures it may not look interesting but trust me, the moment you reach there you really want to take as many pictures as possible and keep all the memories forever with you because that place just looks so beautiful and stunning. #MyVisitKoreaStory$$I was in Gyeongbokgung Palace back in this May and it's one of the most important and beautiful site to visit while in Seoul. The view inside the palace just looks stunning and it's pretty big place too walk around too. The construction and roof tiles is definitely unique and artistic for the ancient palaces. There is also a museum and there are just so many things to see and of course many pictures to take too :D. I'm looking forward to visit Gyeongbokgung again in another season during winter when the view is completely different from Summer. #MyVisitKoreaStory$$#MyVisitKoreaStory This meal at Jinokhwa Halmae Wonjo Dakhanmari is situated at an alley at Dongdaemun (ÎèôÎåÄÎ¨∏) never failed to erase off my memory for the best delicious chicken pot that can be so exciting with the variety of condiments, kimchi, rice cakes and noodles that surprisingly from a plain chicken hotpot that can magically turn into the best Chicken Hot pot that I ever tasted in my whole life. It was the most memorable dish for me and certainly I been craving and wanting to go back there to indulge again.  #KoreaTourismOrganizationVisitKorea$$#MyVisitKoreaStory from October 2015

Autumn is my favorite season and it is unfortunate that we don't experience it in the Philippines. That's why on my first solo trip during autumn in Seoul, I took the time to visit Seoraksan located in the nearby province of Seokcho. I reached this beautiful mountain via the Dongbu bus line. Upon reaching the foot of the mountain where the trails begin, the orange and yellow leaves of the trees of Seorak are already visible. There are a lot of hiking trails and you can choose from which way to begin by the signages. I went to Biryong falls, Myeonsangil path, path to Biseondae rocks and Sinheungsa temple. Although I was not equipped enough to go to Ulsanbawi where the famous rigged stony trail is found on the way to the summit. It was a very manageable day hike for my first time hiking the trails alone. The tension bridge in the picture leads to a falls located deeper into the hiking trail. I plan to be back in spring and explore the nearby places around Seokcho.

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Samal, Davao

What is it like? 
Once a full-fledged pearl farm, the Pearl Farm Beach Resort rents villas inspired by traditional architecture and boasts panoramic views of the postcard-perfect surrounding gulf.

How to get there: 
Fly into Davao from Manila, Butuan, Cagayan de Oro, Cebu, Clark, Dipolog, Iloilo, Kalibo, Puerto Princesa, Zamboanga,or Singapore. Or take a bus to Davao from Manila or any major town or city in Mindanao.

Fun Fact: 
Make sure you visit the resort's Mandaya weaving center, where Mandaya women use traditional weaving methods to create colorful and intricately patterned products.

Photo by/Author: 
Daniel Carpentier/Magnus Ahmad

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Batanes, Luzon

What is it like? 
The Payuhwan Festival is a celebration of the establishment of the civil government of Batanes. It's highlighted by activities that showcase the Ivatans' history and culture.

How to get there: 
Fly into Batanes from Manila, Cagayan or Ilocos Norte.

Fun Fact: 
Don't miss the Payuhwan Festival trade fair. It showcases native Ivatan products like furniture, wine and vinegar.

This facility can be availed for the purposes of business, tourism, conference and medical. Validity of this visa after entry will be for a period of 30 days. 
 
http://mha1.nic.in/pdfs/visaarrivaljapanesenationals_22012016.pdf  

The Ministry of Tourism has placed the services of Japanese Interpreters at New Delhi Airport ( Immigration hall)  to guide and assist the Japanese Nationals arriving by the Visa on Arrival.

message+desc:
The "Deoksugung, in my hands" mobile app is now available for download for free. 

The app is an AR (Augmented Reality) unmanned tour guide system for cultural treasures. It's main services include: 

1. Providing contents of a tour guide about cultural treasures
- Using different contents such as images, texts, video clips to make storytelling for a tour guide on your smartphone.
- Tour guide of the cultural treasures is modeled as a 3D character, AR storylines are made of information about cultural treasures and to make AR even more realistic, we built 2D and 3D objects to add on.
- Diverse contents of the cultural treasures are provided to the user through the latest smartphone-related techniques such as AR.
- It covers a broad range of users and offers many tour guide modes (Normal mode, Personal mode, and Quest Mode).

2. Local area tour guide service
- Information about tourist sights, restaurants, accommodation and events around the areas of the cultural asset is provided to visitors through the Tour API connection.
- Location-based service offers a navigation function of checking the current location and directions (Map) to tourist sights.

3. Cultural asset Guideboard QR Code Recognition Service and Social Network Services (SNS)
- QR code recognition service for cultural asset guideboardsis provided that visitors can leave comments about QR codes
- Questions about cultural treasures can be answered via Twitter.
comments: Wow One App Got it all & Good use of Technology!!$$Does this only feature places in Korea?? Or does it also include other countries?$$That is amazing and so useful for visitors.$$the best mobile  app of all time!!!! :)$$Does it only do the one location in Seoul? It doesn't have a choice to change locations?$$smart and interactive!!that's daebak!! ^^

message+desc:
Wouldn‚Äôt you like to free yourself from the stress in your life?
A journey to the UNESCO World Heritage Site, ‚ÄúYakushima Island‚Äù, could be the answer.
Located in southern Japan in Kagoshima Prefecture, this island with ancient, immense forest filled with magnificent trees estimated to be over 2,000 years old is waiting for you.
Looking for activities? The main highlight is a hike through lush vegetation that takes between one to ten hours to complete, depending on the course. You may even catch a glimpse of wild monkeys or deer on the road!

Related Information
http://japan-magazine.jnto.go.jp/en/1503_yakushima.html 
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/rtg/pdf/pg-708.pdf
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/scenic/worldheritage/c_12_yakushima.html
comments: I am lucky enough to have been. It is worth the trip for the forests alone, it is an incredible place. Beyond that though there are a few onsen as well, including one in a rock pool down on the shore, beaches and waterfalls. You can see monkeys as you can see above and there are deer as well. The people I interacted with were also really friendly and helpful.$$Why do you torture me with all these beautiful places I want to see but cant right now?!$$I have been to monkey island so enjoyed it dident realise you come face to face with the monkeys$$Japan is a CHEATER on volleyball today... Go to hell JAPAN..... JAPAN has no SPIRIT....

message+desc:
Kyoto is a wonderful city for not only visiting traditional places but also going shopping. There is a shopping street, called "Shin-kyogogu" located in Shijo Kawaramachi. You can enjoy shopping souvenirs as well as various modern clothes and stuff with reasonable prices! It's fun to walk through the shopping arcade in the picture! If you love shopping, you can't miss this spot! 

Shopping in Kyoto: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/attractions/shopping/shopguide/kyoto.html

Shinkyogoku-dori Street: http://www.pref.kyoto.jp/visitkyoto/en/theme/amusement/downtown/st_shinkyogoku/

Our current plan is to stay for 11 nights in Tokyo (with multiple day trips outside of Tokyo) and 3 nights in Kyoto (with a day trip to Nara). Here's my Japan Bucket List: http://www.mydreamcametrue.com/japan I'd love to hear about your favorite experiences and places to eat (especially inexpensive restaurants popular with the locals and restaurants with great vegetarian options) in Tokyo Disneyland, Tokyo DisneySea, Tokyo, Kyoto, Hakone, Kamakura, Yokohoma, Nikko, Kyoto, and Nara. After I return, I'll be writing reviews of my adventure. An index of my Japan reviews will be posted here: http://www.mydreamcametrue.com/japan$$Bought a lot of Japanese spices and souvenirs there. Call out to all the night owls out there!ü¶â

Seoul Bamdokkaebi Night Market is back to entertain all those who love Seoul night life!üòöüòç

From foodüç¥, shoppingüõçÔ∏è and entertainmentüé∂, this is a must go event for all those who are/will be visiting Seoul!

From Mar 24 to Oct 29, come out on Fridays and Saturdays to enjoy the fun atmosphere with your friends and family!üòâ

For more infoüëâhttp://bit.ly/2nuLxwjSeoul Bamdokkaebi Night Market is like a goblin‚Äôs trick, appearing quickly at night only to disappear in the morning.
comments:
Been to this event a couple of times. The lines at the food trucks are insane and ridiculously long; anywhere from 1 to 3 hours! We were so hungry that we just went off-site to eat. After the lines got shorter, the food was sold out. I'm hoping that either supply has gotten better to meet demand this year or there will be more vendors to help with availability. But be prepared to either not eat what you first wanted or just eat something small before getting there. 

The event is a lot of fun and lots of interesting shopping and snacks to be tried (someone was selling amazing homemade creme br√ªl√©e last year) so if you have patience, you'll enjoy it. Just remember: looooooooong lines await.$$Oh, only til Oct. :-( Will be missing this on my Nov. trip.$$Putri Dwi Juniarti do you think that Kim shin and Wang yeo will be there too saem? „Öã„Öã„Öã„Öã„Öã, it's dokaebbi night after allüòàüòÜüòç$$Kally Louise another night market that sounds cool! message+desc:
After spending at least a month in every country, this travel writer ranked the best countries in Southeast Asia for travel. Do you agree with her? Tell us in the comments section below!

https://www.thrillist.com/travel/nation/the-best-countries-in-southeast-asia-to-visit-rankedSomehow we only mention "The Beach" once!
comments:
Ph in the middle is abit low i think.. Except for the food complaint, i am not sure where he got his trouble with atm`s and bus seats... usually works fine for me, foreign credit cards and foreign bodytype :)   Thailand on top? only 1st  they have the right to is the food.. for the rest.. meh..  top notch thai resorts are also the best in SE Asia, but who can slosh out 800 dollar a night for that?  And they really suffer under the one thing they are really proud of.. that they never were a colony.. good for them, of course, but it also means introvertion, no curiosity towards other cultures, No foreign language skills outside main cities&tourist places.  All this is no problem for the thais,, but when considered as a tourist destination.. not so good.. One month in each place is also way too little.. i have racked up 5 months in the Ph.. and my bucket list just getting longer and longer :) As opposed to Thailand, where i was more or less bummed out by most of the things there after less than 3 months in total..$$I don't know why they love Thai foods!! My goodness I tried some of their foods especially the noodle in Bangkok and I would say it really tastes bad. The Philippines' just really not clear for some foreigners because honestly we're very different compared to our asian neighbors. They are composed of temples and other REALLY ASIAN icons and we have that big difference of having western culture and tradition which makes us not so familiar in the word ASIAN as even foreigners thinking if we're really asian or pacific islanders. But not too bad having western culture as it  doesn't makes us different from asia < I guess we're just having a big difference compare for them. #Philippines$$Not really bec she ranked PH midlist, which is not bad, bec of nonfunctional atms and small seated busses. If she had ranked the places base on the amount and quality of attractions, PH should be at least no 2 or 1.  JS$$Ranking is subjective. I just have to react to the suggestion to "improve the cuisine". Our food is part of who we are. Take it or leave it. And yes, we love adobo.$$I think issue with pinoy food is that we have lots of variety and havent figure out yet what we have to showcase to tourist, we have been serving them fiesta foods over and over like lechon,lechon kawali, kare kare, etc.. this are unhealthy and health conscious wouldnt rave about this
Why not develop our food identity by focusing on whats uniquely pinoy, like for soup, tinola, for vegetable laing, for chicken, inasal, for pork,pochero or adobo or even dinuguan, for fish kilawin tanigue,tinolang isda and the list goes on.

We can even introduce them with boodle fights, which gave new yorkers good impression on our food, filipino food has a lot of potential we just havent figure out yet where to start, and what food we have to focus on$$By placing the Philippines on the 6th spot, I don't think this man really experienced what the Philippines is all about...$$Thailand, Indonesia, & Malaysia, all better than Philippines. but not Cambodia! How can anybody pick Cambodia as #1 is beyond me! Cambodia is still struggling with having enough electricity and proper paved roads and high poverty! and the health care is usually no good. at least in Philippines the health care is good and affordable, among other things. definitely Indonesia has everything and more than any other Southeast Asian country, security is professional, food is amazing, health care good & affordable, infrastructure good, and prices cheap, plus many more things! plus the many foreigners & tourists to not make you feel like some kind of orphan.therefore Indonesia #1! :) (y)$$Hmmm I think our government should take this constructively. There are so many challenges foreigners must take to get into their destinations. Kaya no wonder to this man üòÅ.$$Kind of spot on with the review, where are the veggies?  However, both visits I entered thinking "what am I doing here" but by the end I didn't want to leave.
http://wp.me/p79l93-tX$$I love my country,  the beautiful PHILIPPINES...$$They are all the Same. message+desc:
8 Ways to Greet your Elders This Chinese New Year

Fear no more awkward silences this Chinese New Year with this list of dialect words to greet your elders as your bible.

Happy Chinese New Year everyone!

http://www.thesmartlocal.com/read/pioneers-cny-dialectFear no more awkward silences this Chinese New Year with this list of words to greet your elders as your bible.
comments:
In case you don't know, mandarin is also a dialect, from the north.$$Zixian Lu, actually you should be ashamed that you can't speak your language. Mandarin is a beijing dialect. It was forced on us by LKY. The native languages of Singaporeans are hokkien, teochew, cantonese, Hakka, etc. Even reading this makes me sad. The part where it says "so that you can talk to your grandparents". 

An entire generation that built the nation has been alienated and another generation entirely brainwashed. And nobody notices, nobody cares and nobody can do anything about it. Pathetic state of affairs.$$This idea can backfire, because from this greeting alone they might think you picked up the dialect and ask you a series of questions in that dialect.

Then you have a REALLY awkward silence.$$Lousy pronunciation... So off!! Boys and girls please dun pick up the chui hokkien from here...$$People need to realise that there ARE proper regulated systems to write Hokkien and other "dialects" :/

message+desc:
Kagura (Á•ûÊ•Ω) is the dance of spirits performed with traditional music called "Gagaku" and has a wide range of stories based on the history or myths of the land in Japan.

Iwami Kagura is performed in Shimane Prefecture. In one of their programs, huge serpents come out on stage!

The spectacle will make you gasp in amazement for sure!

Shimane Prefecture: http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/regional/shimane/

message+desc:
SHARE OF THE WEEK: This shot of Baluarte Rock in Apo Island, Negros Oriental is from Nethanel Jao. He shares that the marine habitat around the island is a marine reserve, protected by the National Integrated Protected Area Act (NIPA) and under the jurisdiction of the Protected Area Management Board (PAMB). That's why it's a must-see for divers and snorkeling enthusiasts! 

Thanks for sharing Nethaneel!

Yokote Kamakura Snow Festival will be held at Yokote City, Akita pref. from February 15th to 16th. At the festival, there will be more than 100 kamakura (snow huts) which can seat up to 4 or 5 adults.
Children inside the kamakura invite passers-by to come in and offer amazake and rice cake. Visit there and enjoy the traditional winter festival!
 More details:„ÄÄhttp://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/location/spot/festival/kamakurasnow.html

message+desc:
Get ready for a spy-themed interactive dinner, set in a fantasy world of secret agents and evil mob bosses.

"The Spy, The Thug, His Wife and Her Lover' takes you on a thrilling adventure through elaborately designed sets such as a prison cell and a submarine! For one night, you'll get to step into the shoes of a secret agent as you work with The Spy to bring down a powerful mob boss. You'll have to find your way out of sticky situations whilst concealing your secret identity! Apart from getting to interact with the colourful characters, you'll also be served a four-course meal prepared by The Quarters. 

Find out more about @Andsoforth's latest interactive dining experience
https://andsoforth.com.sg/#spythugwifelover

message+desc:
Where is it? 
Masbate, Bicol

What is it like? 
Over 400 cowboys join the Masbate Rodeo every year, and compete for five days. Bull riding, street wrestling, whip cracking and load-carrying are just some of the events in this massive festival.

Fun Fact: 
There are usually 250 heads of cattle and 50 bulls in the rodeo.

Photo by/Author: 
Tourism Department Philippines/Meggy De Guzman

message+desc:
Their annual CNY street bazaar is even bigger this year with over 440 stalls spread across 5 different streets in Chinatown

Apart from CNY classics like pineapple tarts, there's also popular street food such as Dragon Breath which lets you breathe out smoke like a dragon! For the first time ever, there will also be stalls by young entrepreneurs offering innovative street food like the world's FIRST ice cream vending machine, shabu-shabu burgers and watermelon volcanoes!

Date: 6th ‚Äì 27th January 2017 
Time: 6.00pm ‚Äì 10.30pm (Daily) 6.00pm ‚Äì 1.00am (Chinese New Year‚Äôs Eve)

message+desc:
Title: Sakura on a rainy day
Nickname: EYLC
Location: Hirano Jinja, Kyoto
Date: April 16, 2010
Description: On a walk near my area in Kyoto during late afternoon on a rainy day. Many sakura petals had been beaten by the rain and fallen everywhere on the ground. The raindrops on the petals had a sense of 'aware' beauty and I couldn't resist taking photos of these petals.
comments: It's a beautiful and sensitive phot that reveals the poetic and original point of view of the artist/photographer. Congratulations.$$I <3 <3 <3 Edward! love the colours and textures!  beautiful. xo$$This is beautiful.... Its so simple but you linger on its subtle beauty. WOW!$$Thanks everyone! Very pleased I can share my sakura appreciation with you :)$$Beautiful... my daughter loves the cherry blossom season. Good luck in the contest.

message+desc:
Where is it?
Mangenguey Island, Palawan

How to Get There:
Fly from Manila to Busuanga, then transfer to a van bound for Coron.

What is it?
The Calamian group of islands in Busuanga, Palawan is filled with tiny, idyllic tropical islands like Mangenguey. Walk a few steps from the shore, and already you‚Äôll be surrounded by the most colorful coral and fish.

Fun Fact:
You can snorkel, surf, swim and dive in this island paradise!

Photo by / Headline by:
Meggy de Guzman / Meggy De Guzman

message+desc:
Where is it?
Coron, Palawan

What is it?
Coron is a small island located at the northern tip of the island of Palawan. It‚Äôs famous for its beauty both above ground and underwater. See its limestone cliffs and lagoons. 

Fun Fact:
Sunken Japanese warships also rest in these waters.

Photo by / Headline by:
Bob Whorton / Rachel Teotico

message+desc: Holy mountain, Batman! This is Mt. Banahaw, located between the provinces of Quezon and Laguna. Really called a "holy mountain" by locals, its mystic charm continues to attract visitors both near and far. Thanks to Ray Tarol for this fantastic shot! Share your own photos  at http://www.funambassador.com.ph
comments:
Wow!majestic Place,I love to be with Nature. <3$$and I belong to this place$$Many Pacific rim volcanoes endure explosive eruptions at some point. That's clearly evidenced when looking at the remaining structure of Banahaw. Mayon will one day endure the same type of explosion.

As for this mountain, It would be nice to go hiking, or even camp, in the interior of this fabulous geologic structure.$$Amazing..,,,{^¬∑^} Our Beautiful Country. "Thank you Lord."$$Wow this is the first time I saw banahaw in aerial view! 
Perfect Gods creation ;)$$Looks like the mouth of a volcano!

message+desc:
Various events are held throughout the year in Japan's southern islands of Okinawa. From the New Year onwards, traditional festivals and modern events showing the energy of today's Okinawa vie for position. In this issue of the Web magazine, we introduce events in Okinawa from January through to December. There are so many exotic and fun events held in Okinawa ‚Äì from the ‚ÄúEisa‚Äù Bon festival dance and Japan's earliest opening of the beach season through to the Okinawan fisherman (uminchu) festival of ‚ÄúHari‚Äù. By all means, please visit Okinawa and check out some of these events in person.
http://www.jnto.go.jp/eng/indepth/exotic/JapanesQue/special/okinawa005.htmlCountless traditional events and festivals are held in Okinawa throughout the year, many of which are held in line with the old Japanese calendar and are fused with unique Okinawan culture, having started in the Ryukyu Kingdom era. From events making the most of Okinawa's beautiful natural environme...
comments: Okinawa on CNN Travel http://travel.cnn.com/explorations/play/citypulse/underground-okinawa-380685
